story:
This artbook is for the fans of the work of Lena Dai on The Big Book and for the fans of Witch Memory. Or for those who love great art.

The book will have 46 illustrations and 92 pages with a sexy and nude version each time. Discover Callistra, Clea, Kira and other characters in different ways.

23 illustrations are ready. The book will be finished on december.

Each illustration will include the normal and nude version in full color.

One example:

 

What is a lenticular?

 

 

 

A PART FOR THE ARTIST

A PART FOR SHIPPING

A PART FOR TAXES

A PART FOR INDIEGOGO

A PART TO PRINT THE ARTBOOK

A PART TO PRINT THE LENTICULAR

Lena Dai is a freelance Peruvian artist based in Lima, Peru, with training in the field for over 10 years. Among her publications: Trinquette Weeklies, two stories in the Vanadis collectives, Hombre Diablo fanbook México (joint participation), Pin-Up Girls, artbook printed in Ecuador and The Femme in Blue, artbook printed in France by GDBM. She currently works as a colorist (Figures, Chambre 13...) and illustrator (Witch Memory Pin-Ups) for GDBM editions. Her work is centered on super Pin-Ups (erotic or sexy).

story:
THE END IS NEAR

Dryden County, Montana

Weeks have passed since the vanishing... all that was pure is gone... Society is on the verge of collapse and rapidly melts away. Some look up, some run, and others are prepared.

This series begins with Dan Whitehurst, an alcoholic Corrections Officer at Dryden Max Security Penitentiary who is on the verge of mental collapse. His wife and daughter are among "the vanished."

Dryden prison is home to the miscreants of society . . . and it is a powder keg of anger and violence about to erupt.

Suddenly a black cloud appears over Earth and engulfs the planet in darkness. All satellite signals are lost. The power is out and those remaining are on their own. This is when the nightmare truly begins. Like a veil, the black cloud lifts away the masks of deception revealing our true human nature. World wide those with pure evil and hate in their heart become "the possessed."

Dan, like so many, is unchanged. A soul with no home. Dan finds himself in the eye of the storm as "the possessed" take control of the prison and wreak havoc on the remaining inhabitants of Dryden County.

Meanwhile, elsewhere in Dryden County...

Ray Chavez takes shelter in a nearby multi-million dollar bunker along with his family and close friends. Ray and his people hope to escape the chaos and confusion that plagues society and lay low, trying to keep what is left of their lives intact.

The flood of evil is spreading. Will Ray and Dan cross paths? Will they be friends, allies, or even enemies? Only time will tell.

Will they survive where DEVILS REIGN?

 

NOTE: This series is intended for Mature Audiences. It contains violence, profanity, sexual themes and other content suitable only for mature (17+) readers.

 

PREVIEW

Here is a preview of Issue 1, PAGES 4-8

 

 

Above: Though it won't be seen on Issue 1, this is our title font for future issues!

 

 

Characters

Dan Whitehurst is a Corrections Officer at DRYDEN Maximum Security Prison. He lost his wife and only daughter in the disappearance. Without them as his guiding light, what will become of Whitehurst?

Ray Chavez will do anything for his family. Before the disappearances he lived in New York and many years ago him and his buddies purchased some land in Montana to build a bunker. Now the time has come to use it.

This is Samantha Chavez, Ray's wife. She plays a large role in Ray's decision making and isn't afraid to speak her mind. Her life revolves around Ray and her children, she would do anything and everything to protect them.

Brody Chavez is the youngest in the Chavez family. He loves punk rock and even though he seems rough around the edges, he has a big heart!

Sidney Chavez is the oldest son of Ray and Samantha. He loves sports and is always there when you need him.

 

REWARDS

  • $3    Get the NEW  Digital copy!
  • $4    Get the NEW  Physical copy!
  • $14     FUN FUND Bundle
    • Physical copy
    • Digital copy
    • GOODIES
  • $20    COLLECTORS Bundle
    • Physical copy Signed, Numbered (out of 500)
    • LIMITED EDITION Print/Image
    • Plus your name printed in the ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
    • Digital copy
  • $50    NOIR Bundle
    • Physical copy Signed, Numbered (out of 500)
    • ORIGINAL ART - B&W
    • Plus your name printed in the ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
    • Digital Copy
  • $80    INDIE Bundle
    • ORIGINAL ART - Watercolor
    • Physical copy Signed
    • Plus your name printed in the ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
    • Digital Copy
  • $125     AD SPACE Bundle
    • Ad space in Issue #1 –
    • 1/3 page for Fellow Indie Creators!!
    • No nudity please!! Will be printed B&W and will be on a page following the story of ISSUE #1 :)
    • Physical copy Signed
    • Plus your name printed in the ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
    • Digital Copy

* GOODIES will include - buttons, stickers, bookmarks, and more!*

** Print options will be shown in CONCEPT ART section**

 

Below - Examples of 9x12 Single Figure B&W

 

 

Below - Examples of WATERCOLOR

 

 

CONCEPT ART

 

A Close One

Dan Whitehurst and Leil

"Lets watch the world burn" 

Ray and Samantha Chavez

Barrabas

One of the many possessed to be seen in this series

Possessed Inmate

Unknown

Possessed Inmate

Jeffery Aidan

Tall Demon

 

 

FUNDING

 

Our goal would be to raise at least $1500 for this first issue. The costs would be a majority for printing so we can distribute copies at local comic shops and for our fans online! It would also cover the 5% takeaway from Indiegogo, Rewards from the tiers, provide some wiggle room for shipping costs, as we are not sure the exact cost it'll be to get them out to you, and the leftover money would go towards the production costs for Issue 2. We appreciate any and all contributions! You're all helping a dream become reality!

 

PRINT DETAILS for the book:

  • Number of Pages: 28 pages
  • Finished Size: 6.625”w X 10.25”h
  • Text Stock: Printed on 70# High Bright Paper
  • Cover Stock: Printed on 80# High Gloss Paper
  • Binding: Saddle-stitched

 

Thank you for your support, it’s 100% fans like you that help independent projects like ours be created.


 

MEET THE TEAM

Members of the team, TEAM REIGN, are: Rudy Orozco, Micah Maté, Alexa Lopez, and Abel Garcia. The team originated with Rudy having Abel read his screenplay he wrote a few years ago. Abel read the story, liking SURVIVAL HORROR, scary stories, and comics, he felt there was potential to hit well with today’s survival horror community. Rudy and Abel allied together to push the story to its full potential: creating a comic book, then making a graphic novel, and to eventually becoming a film, it’s original idea. They brought in Alexa to help with Digital Media due to them juggling work, family, and creating a comic book. After many flyers and meet ups, we found our artist, horror savant, Micah Maté. Team Reign was formed, eager to get the story to horror fans and comic book fans, and those simply craving a new story to be experienced!

 

Follow Us On Social Media!

Instagram : @DEVILSREIGNPROJECT

@ARTOFMICAHMATE

Twitter : @DEVILSREIGNPROJ

Facebook : DEVILS REIGN PROJECT

 

Thank you for your support, it’s 100% fans like you that help independent projects like ours be created.

 

NOTE: This series is intended for Mature Audiences. It contains violence, profanity, sexual themes and other content suitable only for mature (17+) readers.

story:
Putting the Science Back in Science-Fiction.

After the Gold Rush is a return to optimistic Science-Fiction. It follows Scout, the last scientist, as she returns to Earth to find it in a state of wilderness. She grew up on one of Saturn's moons, Titan, learning to become a biologist and a chemist. However, something went wrong and she has been in cryo-sleep for some time. Eventually, she lands on her ancestral home of Earth and instead of the Star Trek like utopia she was expecting...she encounters a lush and natural Earth. 

I would say more...but you simply must read it for yourself. 

It is good to have warnings, but it is better to have goals. Science-Fiction is full of important stories warning us about the dangers of our hubris. That is a useful lesson, but it shouldn't be all we use the genre for. I grew up watching Star Trek, a show about exploration, progress, and ethics. While it didn't always nail the details, it cared about science and reason. After the Gold Rush is my small attempt to return some of those ideas to modern Science-Fiction. This comic is also about the value of skepticism, and explaining what that means. Too often, skeptics are synonymous with cynics. I want to show what skepticism is really about - caring about what's true. 

Miles Greb - Creator & Writer - Former Bob Dylan impersonator who's obsession with Star Trek is annoying to everyone.  

Elli Puukangas - Pencils & Inks - Freelance illustrator from Finland, living in the UK. Loves rats and all things Victorian.

Mikael H. - Colorist - A comic artist from Finland living in an ivory tower in the middle of a city, surrounded by figurines and stuff for drawing.  

Andrew Pierce - Editor - Lovable goof. Escaped Kipling protagonist.  

Jamie Me - Lettering - Letterer who spends his time wearing pajamas called a 'gi' while learning the art of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.  

Barry Blankenship - Cover Artist & Logo Design - Amateur cursing cat ventriloquist.  

Sweeney Boo -  Sweeney is a comic artist and illustrator living in Canada. Ladies and fashion are two of her favorite things to draw. 

Isaac La Russa - Lead Artist & Concept Artist - Based in Illinois, he wears motley flannels and owns two ungrateful cats.

Ben Rodgers - Assistant Editor - Historian of historical biographies, at least he was historically.  

You can follow the project closer at - @Goldrushcomic.

 

 A Look at the Comic Book Itself! 

  • Each Issue contains 22 pages of comic book, and several illustrated pages of extra Science content! Except for Issue #5, that is giant sized, with 32 whole pages. 
  • Comic Books are peer reviews, just like real science. If you find anything inaccurate in the book, write it in and we will print a correction!
  • The books are printed at a very high quality that rival any of the larger comic publishers,

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Comics!

The reason we are all here, right? The previous books are each 22 page, with a fully illustrated profile of a famous scientist, a few pages of the web-comic prequel series, and the Peer Review science section. However, Issue #5 is going to be a Giant Sized 32 pages! Printed in super high quality, using PrintNinja!

 

 

 Variant Cover!

This Variant Cover is drawn by none other than Isaac La Russa. We will only be printing 25 copies of this cover, it is a very limited edition. All copies will be signed by Miles Greb. 

 

Art Print

This beautiful print is available at some levels, or can be added to any level by simply adding $5 to your pledge. It is done by the amazing Charles Tan. It will be 8 1/2 by 11, printed on a really nice paper. 

 

Stickers

A 3 inch round sticker, featuring a phrase you will see in After the Gold Rush #5. Plus, it's just a really good message!
story_txt:
Putting the Science Back in Science-Fiction.

After the Gold Rush is a return to optimistic Science-Fiction. It follows Scout, the last scientist, as she returns to Earth to find it in a state of wilderness. She grew up on one of Saturn's moons, Titan, learning to become a biologist and a chemist. However, something went wrong and she has been in cryo-sleep for some time. Eventually, she lands on her ancestral home of Earth and instead of the Star Trek like utopia she was expecting...she encounters a lush and natural Earth. 
I would say more...but you simply must read it for yourself. 


It is good to have warnings, but it is better to have goals. Science-Fiction is full of important stories warning us about the dangers of our hubris. That is a useful lesson, but it shouldn't be all we use the genre for. I grew up watching Star Trek, a show about exploration, progress, and ethics. While it didn't always nail the details, it cared about science and reason. After the Gold Rush is my small attempt to return some of those ideas to modern Science-Fiction. This comic is also about the value of skepticism, and explaining what that means. Too often, skeptics are synonymous with cynics. I want to show what skepticism is really about - caring about what's true. 



Miles Greb - Creator & Writer - Former Bob Dylan impersonator who's obsession with Star Trek is annoying to everyone.  
Elli Puukangas - Pencils & Inks - Freelance illustrator from Finland, living in the UK. Loves rats and all things Victorian.
Mikael H. - Colorist - A comic artist from Finland living in an ivory tower in the middle of a city, surrounded by figurines and stuff for drawing.  
Andrew Pierce - Editor - Lovable goof. Escaped Kipling protagonist.  
Jamie Me - Lettering - Letterer who spends his time wearing pajamas called a 'gi' while learning the art of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.  
Barry Blankenship - Cover Artist & Logo Design - Amateur cursing cat ventriloquist.  
Sweeney Boo -  Sweeney is a comic artist and illustrator living in Canada. Ladies and fashion are two of her favorite things to draw. 
Isaac La Russa - Lead Artist & Concept Artist - Based in Illinois, he wears motley flannels and owns two ungrateful cats.
Ben Rodgers - Assistant Editor - Historian of historical biographies, at least he was historically.  
You can follow the project closer at - @Goldrushcomic.
 

 A Look at the Comic Book Itself! 

Each Issue contains 22 pages of comic book, and several illustrated pages of extra Science content! Except for Issue #5, that is giant sized, with 32 whole pages. 
Comic Books are peer reviews, just like real science. If you find anything inaccurate in the book, write it in and we will print a correction!
The books are printed at a very high quality that rival any of the larger comic publishers,


 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 


 
 

 
 

 

 
 

 
Comics!
The reason we are all here, right? The previous books are each 22 page, with a fully illustrated profile of a famous scientist, a few pages of the web-comic prequel series, and the Peer Review science section. However, Issue #5 is going to be a Giant Sized 32 pages! Printed in super high quality, using PrintNinja!
 

 
 Variant Cover!

This Variant Cover is drawn by none other than Isaac La Russa. We will only be printing 25 copies of this cover, it is a very limited edition. All copies will be signed by Miles Greb. 
 
Art Print

This beautiful print is available at some levels, or can be added to any level by simply adding $5 to your pledge. It is done by the amazing Charles Tan. It will be 8 1/2 by 11, printed on a really nice paper.

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to raise money to finish both writing and paintings for the book and for a print run of a hardcover book of our illustrated book  "THE CLOUD SHEPHERD" 

So if the goal is met this is basically a grand pre-order event for the book, much like other crowdfunding campaigns.


The book will be available in German and English. If we raise enough money we will also deliver Italian, Spanish, and French versions.

With a fascinating story line full of action, magic and dreamy illustrations this book will take you into a completely different world where your fantasy can run freely and limitless. 


The specs of the book:  around 90-100 pages - Full color - Hardcover - Sewn binding - Rounded spine - Matt coated interior pages - about 20 pages  will be paintings and illustrations made by Simone.

The book will be the German + English version 

Reaching the goal will cover the cost of a 1000 books print run (the common minimum order for traditional, high quality offset printed books) and Indiegogo's = PayPal cut of the raised funds. If we raise more than the goal we can make the print run bigger and the book even fancier.


Handmade limited edition Mockup.


The story



Peter Swynn is a cloud shepherd, a small boy with a flock of clouds he calls his own. Peter is tending these clouds as others are tending sheep. With his magic crook and his flute he leads the clouds to bring rain to the woodlands and farmers. Together they are wandering the mountains and highlands of Sandora – an island beyond the storm-whipped icy seas of Seolia – last refuge of all magic creatures. Wherever they go they are welcome and appreciated as they would bring rain to the crops, or so they thought...

"On this mild night Peter was playing his lullaby again to the clouds. One by one the still ruffled clouds gathered around the tune and a cozy tranquility started to settle in. Peter had no idea what was lying in wait for him down in the misty valley: loss, adventure, war, as well as his fate, friendship and love. Even more unexpected was the circumstance that he, despite all his inconspicuousness, would hold all magic peoples' fate and happiness in his small hands."

Join us on his journey !




A bit about Marc

Hello! I'm one of the founders of this project.

I had worked for over 10 years as a computer animator in the film industry in locations such as Munich, Berlin and London. After that I was hired by Mercedes Benz Design Studio in 2002 to work as visualisation artist and since then I have been working as CGI Senior Artist for the best car brands across Europe, like Bugatti, Jaguar, Opel, Volkswagen...

I have 4 children and I have told them hundreds of improvised bedtime stories in the past 12 Years. Sometimes I would turn off the lights and think: "Wow, what a great story, maybe I should write this down!"

Things have changed a lot because of crowdfunding platforms. Great and challenging ideas can be transformed into something bigger thanks to the help of thousands of generous and inspired people around the globe!


A bit about Simo

Hi! The best way to quickly describe myself is by saying that I'm in love with painting... I've always been and I'll always be. I'm a matte painter/concept designer for films, tv, commercials and, hopefully with your help, book illustrations.

I've been doing this for a while now, living in Torino, Los Angeles, London, Stuttgart, Hamburg and Munich.

Recently my matte paintings for "The Grand Budapest Hotel" have been awarded with the Oscar in Best Production Design. You can see my works in other films as "Cloud Atlas", "Captain America: the Winter Soldier",  "Snowpiercer", "Pompeii" and Ridley Scott's "Exodus: Gods and Kings". Now I decided to paint Marc's fantasy world for all of you.



Why we need your support

Even though we're very happy and passionate about what we do every day, we need your help to be able to realize our dream, to create a fantastic world and represent it in a beautiful way.  Over a decade the "Cloud Shepherd" has remained stored in a box.

Let's unbox it!


Why we need these funds

We have the the skills and the dedication to see the project through, and to be financially and ethically accountable to our community of backers.

However, we need 40.000 $ to cover the following expenses:

  • Cover living costs for the time necessary to finalize the production of TCS, production and printing costs, project promotion's costs, cover billing registration related costs, Indiegogo and Paypal fees.
  • If goals are NOT reached Indiegogo will refund you automatically.

So...What can you do?


  • - if you haven’t done it yet, secure your own numbered and signed copy of "The Cloud Shepherd" or maybe there’s someone you could think of who would like it as a Christmas or birthday present?
  • - remind people on twitter, facebook, google+, reddit, myspace (no social media discrimination :D) that we only have this chance to make it happen. Remember to link the campaign page!
  • - spread the word by simply talking about it!!


Stretch goals

  • $ 40.000 hardcover full color book "TCS", incl. 10 illustrations made by Simone
  • $ 60.000 We will be able to nearly double the number of paintings and sketches and we will add 1-2 chapters 
  • >$ 90.000  We could deliver "The Cloud Sheperd" Volume 1 and will dedicate every day to produce all art work and writing for The Cloud Shepherd, Vol.2": "The Cloud Portal", the second book of the Cloud Shepherd Trilogy.


Risks and challenges

The book and its writing and paintings are artisanal and hand-crafted, so there may be delays. I'm aiming to have the whole thing cleaned up, proof-read and all illustrations finished and prepped for print by beginning of the year (2016), so it should be printed and ready to be shipped before springtime in 2016, but if any issues should arise, I will keep donors informed and updated on the progress along the road.


Shipping costs

All EU-resident backers please add 6,00€ to cover the packing & shipping costs for every Perk, NOT INCLUDING those containing Karma :) or digital contents.

For non EU customers, please contact us to define shipping costs (depending on items weight and country of residence).

story:
Introducing: The Black Sun Universe

The Black Sun Universe is an epic comic book series with the central character Tyrus, a self-proclaimed Overlord and his sole attempt to collect nine stones hidden throughout the universe. In each story in the series, and throughout millennia, different bloodlines do everything in their power to stop Tyrus. Should he succeed, he would become the true conqueror of the Black Sun Universe.

To continue the series, we turn to you, to assist in covering the costs of hiring additional writers and graphic artists. With the impressive work so far, we can expand and build the series further.

We appreciate your support and are offering early access to the comic books and limited-edition Black Sun Universe merchandise toward your contribution.

This is where you come in, Indiegogo.

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I am turning to you in order to raise the funds that I need to cover the costs of hiring additional writers, graphic artists, and business associates to finish producing the comic books in The Black Sun Universe. This project is a massive undertaking, but I believe that all the work that my team and I put in will turn out to be worth it. To show my appreciation for your support, I am offering early access to the comic books and some limited-edition Black Sun Universe merchandise.

 

The Impact

I created these stories to empower young adults and to educate them as well. There will be parallels within the stories to current events, sure to draw a wide audience. Most of all, though, I am creating comic books that people will enjoy!

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond making a monetary contribution, you can show your support for what I am doing by sharing a link to this campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people know what I am doing, the smoother this campaign will go. I appreciate all your support, both monetary and otherwise, and I am excited to do right by all the contributors and make this series great.

www.theblacksununiverse.com

Thank you!

story:
D.A.R.E Agents Issue #1 is a 32 page, Euro-spy, action/comedy comic with suave spies, bumbling henchmen, ridiculous evil genius schemes and inappropriately named 'Femme Fatales'. Think 'Fritz the Cat' meets 'Austin Powers'.

True to the era, D.A.R.E Agents is brimming with Mid-Century style illustrations and graphical overlays that will have the look and feel of comic lost in the Silver Age of Comics. There is also a whole lot of influences from cheesy B-Grade Italian movies true to the era also. There will also have some mock ads placed throughout the comic.

My name is Adin Milo and I'm an illustrator from Sydney, Australia. I grew up on movies like James Bond and Austin Powers, as well as vintage 60s cartoons, including The Pink Panther and Hanna Barbera. Growing up being obsessed with writing movie scripts and drawing the characters in my school books. The idea of creating comics was something I dreamed about since I started putting pen to paper as a kid. And recently I never thought of fusing the two together - until now. 
 

These last 5 years have included me working with professional companies and passionate developers. These include working on projects with Rubber House (Childish Gambino - "Feels Like Summer" Video Clip & HBO Game Of Thrones "Slap Game" short), Sleepyhead Studios Barking Irons game, and Mirrafire Games "Pack of Crooks".

If you want to check out my portfolio, head on over to

adinmilo.myportfolio.com

STRETCH GOAL #1 (10,250) - Guest artist #1 comission art in D.A.R.E Agents Issue #1  

STRETCH GOAL #2 (10,500) - Guest artist #2 comission art in D.A.R.E Agents Issue #1

STRETCH GOAL #3 (11,000) - Issue #2 & Issue #3 funded 

STRETCH GOAL #4 (11,200) - Bookmark

STRETCH GOAL #5 (11,500) - A2 fold out "D.A.R.E Agents" poster 

STRETCH GOAL #6 (11,750) - Issue #4 & Issues #5 funded 

STRETCH GOAL #7 (12,000) - Hologram sticker of Logo 

STRETCH GOAL #8 (12,500) - D.A.R.E Agents "Toxic Cox Sisters" Rolling Paper

STRETCH GOAL #9 (13,000) - D.A.R.E Agent Enamel Pin 

I'll need roughly $10k AUD to make it all come to fruition with most of the funds helping push D.A.R.E Agents into 5 issues. 

The final figure helps allocate more time to sit down and thoroughly finish the inking of the sketches and thumbnails I have already.

On top of the printing budget, I've allocated the amount of money that I would charge on a commission rate and will instead use those funds for promo, advertising, extra postage charges for bigger packages (permitted the stretch goals get funded), and looking into hiring more versed people to edit and proof D.A.R.E Agents.

story:
STORY

The year is 2048. Zus and his crew is on a mission to destroy all ancients and rule the world. But in order to do that they need to obtain the last orb. Accidentally the orb was obtain by a man that goes by the name Mich. Now obtaining the orb, he has no clue what it was for, but adventures awaits him in this leap of sequence.

 

CONTENT

The book will contain the origin of his story and whats his capabilities. to give you a preview of the art here are some samples.

 

This is just a back cover. we have taken the liking of surprising everyone about the front cover when they you got the book.

CHARACTER SKETCH

Here are a few sketch on the character

 

 

IMPACT

This has been a life long dream of mine to publish my own book. I quit the job I have and took the chances of pursuing a career that i know will change my life.

 

If this is successful, this means that i have chance to create more stories and art that will get people engaging in reading comics. as time fly by, I have observed that the people are declining in reading comics. Same goes to me. as I see to myself that i don't read that much anymore.

 

I'm hoping people around the world would be able to help me out on this. this would be a great achievement and we would be able to create stories that is fresh to the audience. 

 

CREATOR

HEY! this is Jayvee your speaking with. I'm a freelance comics artist for 4 years now. As you can see I'm trying to fund my own book. Reason is, i was inspired by the scripts of my previews work. and decided to give it a try.

I have done the script since last year and didn't have the courage to crowd fund it then, But now im taking risk and take a step forward.

You can check out my only social media account

INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/gungmoillustrator/

 

TIER

Tier 1 : you get a physical copy of the book

Tier 2: you get a physical copy of the book + poster

Tier 3: you get the limited cover of the book. (which we will not post for safety reasons) + physical book+ a T-shirt!

 

 

PERKS

$12,000 strectch goal we'll add 6 more pages

$16,000 each back will recieve an additional poster. plus the poster that is in the other perks.

$24,000 at this point we'll have an advance budget for the next book. And it will mean so much too us.

 

HOW DO WE DO THIS

I have a partner that will be printing the copy there in the other side of the world so its cheaper to ship. after the project is funded we can now start and send to you before the promise deadline. if you have further concern just send as a message we will gladly take your questions. 

 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

The only risk is on me, if the campaign fail, you'll get back all your money back 100% guarantee. we wont be taking any up until it's 100% funded for safety. so you can trust us in delivering this project.

$16,000 each back will recieve an additional poster. plus the poster that is in the other perks.
$24,000 at this point we'll have an advance budget for the next book. And it will mean so much too us.
 
HOW DO WE DO THIS
I have a partner that will be printing the copy there in the other side of the world so its cheaper to ship. after the project is funded we can now start and send to you before the promise deadline. if you have further concern just send as a message we will gladly take your questions. 
 
RISK AND CHALLENGES
The only risk is on me, if the campaign fail, you'll get back all your money back 100% guarantee. we wont be taking any up until it's 100% funded for safety. so you can trust us in delivering this project.

story:
Welcome to Zine Comics and our comic, Forerunners!

Preface: Some of you may have seen my previous attempt to get Forerunners off the ground.  Unfortunately we fell short of our goal of $8,000.  However, we don't give up at Zine Comics.  Like I've posted later in this description the comic is finished.  Therefore I'm not going to let it sit on a dusty shelf.  So, instead I've revamped it into this campaign.  You can get your digital edition for $5 or digital edition and poster for $20.  This way we can still get the comic to you to read and begin building our fanbase that will be excited for years to come for our future projects.  Thank you if you donated on the last campaign and if you donate for this one!  Let's bring Forerunners to life together!

About the comic

Forerunners came from asking the question, what if super villains were to gain super powers before super heroes?  How would the world react?  Would it even survive?  In the first issue, a news reporter goes to cover a story about a science experiment on editing DNA.  During the experiment, the test subject gains unexpected abilities and begins eliminating any witness to her transformation.  It's up to our reporter to escape the massacre in order to warn everyone, but was her transformation just a fluke or a calculated test run?  Read and find out!     

Hello from Zine Comics

My name is Ezekiel Buchanan and I created Zine Comics to get back to the when comics were entertaining.  I've always been interested in telling stories, so I created this company to combine my passion for storytelling and my love for comics to bring you stories that you will enjoy!

Down below you can see a sample of a few pages from the book.  And the best part of this campaign is that I accidentally did all the work up front, so all I need is to go to print.  Yes, you read that right. 

The book is done, finished. 

Once this book is fully backed, then all you have to wait for is the printing press to get it to me, before I get it to you.  No waiting around a year just to see your book here at Zine Comics! 

Comic book preview

Credits

Written and lettered by Ezekiel Buchanan

Illustrated by Christopher Bradberry

Coloring by Guillermo Suarez

About the company

You've heard these values thrown around comicsgate a lot, but I think people have forgotten the core values that started this movement.  I just wanted to let you know that I haven't.  That's why this company was created.  This is our company values:

The customer is first and foremost.  You are the fans.  It's up to you if the comic universe begins or not, that's why you are our priority.  We wanted to create something you enjoy and will want to keep participating in, in future campaigns.  It's also why we finished the book first.  So you don't have to wait around forever to get your copy.

Politics are a not allowed.  Personal politics aren't allowed in our books.  We don't care if you are left or right.  We care that you find our story entertaining.

We bring you the best quality.  We know how frustrating it can be when you buy a comic that looks like someone slopped it out just to get it on the stands.  We took our time and now it's fully ready to be sent to you!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $8,000.  The reason for this is to pay the artist and for paying for printing costs. 

We are keeping our perks simple since we are just starting out.  If all goes well then on our next campaign we can add some more perks.  Our perks include a book mark and a poster by the great artist Preston Asevedo.

If we don't reach our goal, then the funds go back to you!

Risks & Challenges

This is the first campaign we have ever done.  Therefore we are going to have to learn as we go along.  But given time, any obstacle that is put in front of us we will overcome in order to get our comic to you.

One thing you don't have to worry as a reader is when will the comic be ready for print.  Our comic is primed and ready and is only waiting for us to hit our goal before we send it to the printing press. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute that's okay.  If you would still like to help us then post about us on your favorite social media platform to raise awareness of our comic.  It would be a great help!

story:
Your support of this light-novel will also give you access to our website's online manga!

www.PSManga.com

 

 

 

 

This detective light-novel is not for anyone under the age of 18 as it contains adult content and this studio does not support censorship.

A young detective with a big gun and a bad case of Pokephobia is drawn into a world where 99% of pokemon appear human and 1% of pokemon being of pure blood. 100% of them are still seen as property by humans.

With growing unrest, pokemon wish to no longer have masters or trainers and they are willing to step on their own kind to be seen as equals to humans and in some cases, superior.

In these questionable times, Detective Red struggles with Pokephobia but also a strong desire to protect 6 troublesome pokemon who'll stop at nothing to be free.

story:
In Brief:

Hi! I'm Keith! Four artists & I have been working our butts off and created a truly modern interconnected superhero universe. It reflects you, me, & the real world in which we all live, with a huge dose of fantasy and lots o' fun! We call it THE REALITY.

We've got 4 comics. Our 1st issues of each are NOW on Comixology.com, and there's even more info & free previews at TheRealityComics.com, but you can get our digital comics free & all kinds of exclusives by joining The Reality team right here!

The books are standard 22 pages, in b&w.

For more than a year we've been toiling away in our spare time. Now, we want to put The Reality out into the world!

 

Like TV seasons -
a beginning, middle, & end:

Our "Intraverse" is unusual. First, our characters and our world will have a beginning, middle, and end. We'll do this over
3 "seasons." Like a TV a series, we're going to do 24 "episodes" (issues) each season.  There will be single- & multi-issue stories, but the season will have an arc for each character in those 24 issues.

And, yes, we've got amazing plans for our world!

Our characters are not rich billionaires, brilliant scientists, or beautiful, naturally heroic people. Like most folks we all know, they're average, selfish, can't admit when they're wrong; most of 'em don't want to save the world...and they might not. They all have regular lives, honest struggles, friends and personal problems, the kind we deal with in the modern world, some of which most comic books have yet to honestly touch upon.

The people in our world are diverse in a variety of ways (I can list what ways, but we're not really about that -- I mean, do you count how many people from different walks of life, or who have different disabilities or afflictions, exist in your life?), and they are not really heroic. They won't learn to be overnight; some won't learn at all. And while you think you might recognize some familiar tropes and ideas along the way, each book turns familiar concepts on their head!

Oh, and our Intraverse itself has all those fun little Easter eggs, subtle interconnections, secrets, surprises, and all the action & fun fans of comics or books like Game of Thrones and the like tend to enjoy finding. Yeah, it's pretty !$!@in' cool. 



 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Initial Funding:

Priority is getting the letterers & artists paid for 4 issues.
- 4 issues of Lettering is almost $900.
- Because our 1st books are already out there, we'll
need another $900 for issues #2.
- As a team, we've learned we suck at social media. (#truth)
So marketing has been made a priority. This is $2,000 (min. :\ ).
- The artists worked for free (we'll split all sales), and, to keep this
funded, another $2,200 would help them be able to live while making awe-inspiring comics.
______________________________
Total: $6,000

Stretch Funding:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

So far, we've done this all w/out a dime.

From logos and character designs to cover treatments and PR. Layouts to finished art & art corrections, we're doing it all ourselves.

Our team originally consisted of men & women from around the globe, but several moved on to paid projects. This is why checking out issue #1 at Comixology & via THIS FUNDING is so important!

 

 

 

 

"So, What're The Comics About?"

Deathwitch: The Faerie Tale of Trinity Cross: A Whedon-style adventure. Maya Ramachandran loses her family but learns her real dad is alive...and in Hell. Oh, did I mention her dad might be the Devil? Yeah. Weird day.

The Phantom Kid:  A small town sends a teen to the big city to be the superhero they all think he should be, but he's failing and has trouble handing it. (He will soon be joined by young detective Christina Fortis, known on the street w/her big dog as Roja & the Baz)...

Weredevil & the Professor from the Dark Lagoon: Joseph Bayani has terrible secrets...one of them is that, at night, a demon bursts from his body and feeds off of evil. But this story isn't Jekyll & Hyde, it's Hyde & Hyde...and only a mysterious creature from a Dark Lagoon will be able to control them both and save Joseph from himself.

Team Indystructible: Three hopeless washouts are drafted by a bizarre woman with some anger issues for a secret mission. Will they save the Intraverse or doom it? It's hard to tell. 

 

 

The 2 books we want to add:
Spyborg: An A.I. built to defend the world attains sentience & begins building heroes to protect the city...only to come up against the heroes that already defend it.

Plain Jane & The Justice Grrls: An experimental body suit bonds with nerdy teen Hana Hamasaki, but she learns to be super from 3 powerful trans heroes who'll become a better team b/c of Hana.

Me

My background is in writing & editing. I've worked for MTV and some big websites as an editor, written screenplays that received some accolades in contests. A superhero screenplay of mine was well-received by Disney and was good enough that Legendary Pictures gave me a shot at pitching my own take on Man of Steel (before Nolan was on board). I interned at Marvel and DC (& Vertigo), worked at Malibu Comics and was Sr. Editor of Wizard's Toyfare mag. I also once wrote & drew a comic that comics legend Will Eisner read and thus said of me, "You have an obvious instinct for this kind of work."

In spite of all this, I've had trouble breaking through. So I've taken things into my own hands (er, with 4 great artists)!...And, I'm likely biased, but I think it's awesome.

(Sum-up at bottom.)

 


Pencil layouts:

Finished:

 

 

  

In sum:

Issue 1 for EACH book:
Jump on the journey at the start:
All 4 comics are on Comixology.com!
Funds:
Letterers, artists, marketing, printers...and want to get our 2nd issues completed!
Stretch goals:
Print books, further promotion.
Super-stretch goal:
Colors, get the other 2 titles going.

Please spread the word, even if you can't contribute!
You can Retweet us on Twitter (@TheRealityComix)...
Like us on Facebook.com/therealitycomics!...
&, of course, Instagram!

This Indiegogo is meant to get us off the ground, check out our Patreon so we can keep it going!

We've a mailing list signup, previews, details, & even secret stuff at our website, TheRealitycomics.com.

THE LIMITED EDITION PRINTS:

story:
Sziasztok!

A 2015-ös őszi képregénybörzére mi is szeretnénk megmutatni, hogy a horror/thriller képregény műfajnak itthon is vannak rajongói - és alkotói is! 

Antológiánk több rövid történetet és illusztrációt tartalmazna fekete-fehérben, itthon már elismert és (még) kevésbé ismert művészek közreműködésével. Van köztünk grafikus, író, illusztrátor, újságíró, családapa, ami azonban mindegyikünket összeköt, az a vizuálisan és témájában is elborult, mélyebb tartalmú képregények iránti szeretet.

Az antológia 72 oldalán több groteszk és sötét tónusú grafika formájában taglalunk olyan kérdéseket, amelyekkel minden ember találkozhat a hétköznapok során: egyaránt felbukkan a modern társadalom kritikája, az egyén személyisége és fejlődése, a magány, a szerelem, csakúgy, mint az álomszerűen absztrakt, már-már abszurd gondolatok. Csáth Géza adaptációtól (A kályha, A kék csónak novellák ) kezdve egészen a baljós Gyertya Erőd foglyainak szenvedéséig, a nyolcvanas évek gengszterfilmjeiből merítő, embertestbe bújtatott állatok kaszabolásáig tart a spektrum, minden alkotóból egy-egy különleges szeletet megmutatva. 

A termékeny alkotói csapat célja, hogy a megjelenés ne egyszeri alkalomra szóljon, és még több kiadvánnyal, akár rendezvénnyel járulhassunk hozzá a magyar képregény műfaj fejlődéséhez és gazdagításához.

Ha szeretnétek mindennek részesévé válni, és támogatni terveinket, azt az oldalt található csomagokkal háláljuk meg nektek, melyekben az antológián kívül több finomság is található. Mindenekelőtt azonban, hogy az antológia gyártási költségeit fedezni tudjuk, a Ti segítségeteket kérjük! Az antológiát 300 példányban szeretnénk megjelentetni.

Az antológián kívül egy másik képregény - pontosabban egy egyedi megoldású, vizuális novella - a Talaj is megvásárolható, ami Borbás Marci, grafikus diplomamunkája.(Itt megtekinthető számos részlet a képregényből:

 https://www.behance.net/gallery/27173695/TALAJ-SOIL-%28COMIC%29) 

A füzet limitáltan, 50 példányszámban jelenne meg 36 oldalon. 

A pakkok ezen kívül tartalmaznak posztereket, amelyeket a képregények rajzolói, illetve Borbás Róbert tetoválóművész és Brunszkó László street art művész készítenek el. Továbbá jegyzetfüzet, és minden támogatónk részére egy könyvjelző teszi teljessé a kínálatot. Egyedül a posztereket tudjuk külföldre postázni. A kitűzött összeg a képregények, poszterek, jegyzetfüzetek, könyvjelzők díját (és a postaköltséget) fedezi, ezen felül a honlap karbantartását, illetve egyéb járulékos költségeket. Mintaoldalak, tartalomjegyzék és egyéb frissítések a következő link alatt(folyamatos frissítés alatt):

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.58822...

Kik vagyunk mi?

Borbás Bence - rajzoló, író

"Grafikusként tevékenykedem, és körülbelül tíz éves korom óta gyűjtöm a képregényeket. Amikor elkezdtem a Scaremonger Comics-t, valami olyasmit szerettem volna csinálni, amihez sok embernek köze van - elsődleges célommá pedig az vált, hogy a "kiadó" egy olyan csatorna lehessen, ahová örömmel alkotnak a rajzolók, és persze ahová szívesen járnak vissza az olvasók. Remélhetőleg ez most megvalósulhat, amiért már előre is köszönöm mindenkinek a belefektetett munkát, és minden adakozó lelkületű jómunkásember forintját!"

http://scaremongercomics.com

Borbás Márton - design, illusztráció

"21 éves vagyok, és tervezőgrafikával foglalkozom. Főként illusztráció a szakterületem. Ezeket használom fel a többi tervezőgrafikai műfajban is, mint például csomagolás design, magazin layout, vagy jelen esetben a képregény."

https://www.facebook.com/ScarecrowsDesign

Borbás Róbert - illusztráció

"Yo! Borbas Robi vagyok, aka Grindesign. Tetoválóként dolgozom három éve, ezt megelőzően illusztrációval foglalkoztam. Elsősorban póló és lemezborító illusztrációkkal. Remélem elkészülök a munkákkal az ígért határidőig!"

https://www.facebook.com/theartofgrindesign

Brunszkó László - illusztráció

"77 -ben születtem Budapesten. Graffiti, street art festő, illusztrátorként működöm. Az antológiába pedig illusztrációkat fogok készíteni."

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Nikon-One/256213631102083

Dömös Zsuzsanna - író

"Azóta élek a betűk világában, hogy kiskoromban megismerkedhettem a fantasztikus Szerencsekerék című műsorral, ez pedig akkora nyomot hagyott bennem, hogy a betűvetés azóta kenyérszerző tevékenységemmé vált. Szabadúszó újságíróként web, technológia és informatika témákban írok jelenleg több helyre is, többen azonban csak a PC Guru "Lor"-jaként ismernek, aki videojátékokat szed ízeire és sok-sok kávét iszik (néha annyit, hogy már tikkel a szeme). 

http://pcguru.hu; http://ign.hu

Korcsmáros László - rajzoló

"22 éves vagyok, a Moholy-Nagy Művészeti Egyetemen járok tervezőgrafika szakra, emellett van egy Trusting nevű straight edge hardcore zenekarom. Már régóta terveztem Csáth Géza illusztráció készítését, így egyértelmű volt, hogy ez adja az első képregényem alapját, aminek hangulata kellőképp egybevág, életem elmúlt időszakának legfőbb érzéseivel."

https://www.facebook.com/innkeeperart

Lakatos István - rajzoló, író

"Képregényrajzolással kezdtem, de már évek óta könyvillusztrálással foglalkozom. Úgy alakult, hogy véletlenül írtam egy regényt, azután még kettőt, és mindjárt kezdem a következőt. Persze még nem adtam fel ezt a képregényesdit."

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lakatos-Istv%C3%A1n/513025105429104

Nagy Viktor - videó
https://www.facebook.com/mihasznafilm

Pintér Márk - rajzoló

"Elsősorban illusztrációval és képregényekkel, emellett pedig animációval foglalkozom. Már egy éves korom óta mániákusan hódolok a rajzolás örömének, jóformán mindenhová viszek magammal rajzfüzetet és ceruzát a biztonságérzetem érdekében. Imádok mindent, ami nagy szörny, nagy robot vagy nagyon sötét és nyomasztóan szürreális. Ha úgy gondolod, én vagyok az eseted, hívj a....ja...nem...ezt máshová."

https://www.facebook.com/artofmarkpinter

Prim Dániel Attila - író

"Tizenkét éve írok novellákat, regényt, forgatókönyveket és így tovább. Az utóbbi években képregényekre specializálódtam, egyszerűen a médium iránti szeretetből. Nekem a képregények szeretete abból fakad, hogy amikor gyerek voltam, én voltam az egyetlen a környezetemben, aki rendszeresen olvasta őket, amik ettől különlegesek lettek, és úgy éreztem, hogy a képregények egyedül hozzám tartoznak. Szeretek nagyon elmerülni az írásaimban, mindennek másod- és harmadlagos értelmet adni, különböző erőteljes szimbólumokat alkotni. Erőteljes vizuális írónak tartom magam, így feladatomnak érzem, hogy minél kevesebb dolgot mondjak el a szövegbuborékokon belül, és inkább a képi világgal mutassam be a történetet."
https://www.facebook.com/freefantasycomics

Varga Bálint Bánk - író

"27 éves vagyok, jelenleg épp marketingesként tevékenykedek, szóval mondhatni napi 8 órában a kreativitásommal strihelek. Elsősorban írónak tartom magam, és nem feltétlenül azért, mert mások írónak tartanának - inkább csak azért, mert írok. Általában és mindig. Jelenleg egy misztikus drogregényen és egy sumér családregényen dolgozom párhuzamosan, közben másodmagammal a Hegy képregény eposzát építjük panelről-panelre. Megrendelésre is írok pár történetet (köztük egy lovecrafti nyomvonalon haladó regényt), a meg(nem)maradt időmben pedig videojátékok sztoriját farigcsálom. Ja, ex-majdnemhíres-rocksztár vagyok. Vagyis inkább csak ex-majdnem-rokk... A híres és a sztár azt hiszem, nem állná meg a helyét."

https://www.facebook.com/ahegykepregeny

Köszönjük!

Köszönjük mindenki támogatását előre is! A fejleményekről, hírekről a csapat hivatalos facebook oldalán értesülhettek:

https://www.facebook.com/scaremongercomics 

Ha bármilyen kérdésetek van, vagy segítségre lenne szükségetek, az alábbi e-mail címen rendelkezésetekre állunk: scaremongercomics@gmail.com

- a Scaremonger Comics csapata
story_txt:
Sziasztok!A 2015-ös őszi képregénybörzére mi is szeretnénk megmutatni, hogy a horror/thriller képregény műfajnak itthon is vannak rajongói - és alkotói is! Antológiánk több rövid történetet és illusztrációt tartalmazna fekete-fehérben, itthon már elismert és (még) kevésbé ismert művészek közreműködésével. Van köztünk grafikus, író, illusztrátor, újságíró, családapa, ami azonban mindegyikünket összeköt, az a vizuálisan és témájában is elborult, mélyebb tartalmú képregények iránti szeretet.Az antológia 72 oldalán több groteszk és sötét tónusú grafika formájában taglalunk olyan kérdéseket, amelyekkel minden ember találkozhat a hétköznapok során: egyaránt felbukkan a modern társadalom kritikája, az egyén személyisége és fejlődése, a magány, a szerelem, csakúgy, mint az álomszerűen absztrakt, már-már abszurd gondolatok. Csáth Géza adaptációtól (A kályha, A kék csónak novellák ) kezdve egészen a baljós Gyertya Erőd foglyainak szenvedéséig, a nyolcvanas évek gengszterfilmjeiből merítő, embertestbe bújtatott állatok kaszabolásáig tart a spektrum, minden alkotóból egy-egy különleges szeletet megmutatva. A termékeny alkotói csapat célja, hogy a megjelenés ne egyszeri alkalomra szóljon, és még több kiadvánnyal, akár rendezvénnyel járulhassunk hozzá a magyar képregény műfaj fejlődéséhez és gazdagításához.Ha szeretnétek mindennek részesévé válni, és támogatni terveinket, azt az oldalt található csomagokkal háláljuk meg nektek, melyekben az antológián kívül több finomság is található. Mindenekelőtt azonban, hogy az antológia gyártási költségeit fedezni tudjuk, a Ti segítségeteket kérjük! Az antológiát 300 példányban szeretnénk megjelentetni.Az antológián kívül egy másik képregény - pontosabban egy egyedi megoldású, vizuális novella - a Talaj is megvásárolható, ami Borbás Marci, grafikus diplomamunkája.(Itt megtekinthető számos részlet a képregényből: https://www.behance.net/gallery/27173695/TALAJ-SOIL-%28COMIC%29) A füzet limitáltan, 50 példányszámban jelenne meg 36 oldalon. A pakkok ezen kívül tartalmaznak posztereket, amelyeket a képregények rajzolói, illetve Borbás Róbert tetoválóművész és Brunszkó László  street art művész készítenek el. Továbbá jegyzetfüzet, és minden támogatónk részére egy könyvjelző teszi teljessé a kínálatot. Egyedül a posztereket tudjuk külföldre postázni. A kitűzött összeg a képregények, poszterek, jegyzetfüzetek, könyvjelzők díját (és a postaköltséget) fedezi, ezen felül a honlap karbantartását, illetve egyéb járulékos költségeket. Mintaoldalak, tartalomjegyzék és egyéb frissítések a következő link alatt(folyamatos frissítés alatt):https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.58822...Kik vagyunk mi?Borbás Bence - rajzoló, író"Grafikusként tevékenykedem, és körülbelül tíz éves korom óta gyűjtöm a képregényeket. Amikor elkezdtem a Scaremonger Comics-t, valami olyasmit szerettem volna csinálni, amihez sok embernek köze van - elsődleges célommá pedig az vált, hogy a "kiadó" egy olyan csatorna lehessen, ahová örömmel alkotnak a rajzolók, és persze ahová szívesen járnak vissza az olvasók. Remélhetőleg ez most megvalósulhat, amiért már előre is köszönöm mindenkinek a belefektetett munkát, és minden adakozó lelkületű jómunkásember forintját!"http://scaremongercomics.comBorbás Márton - design, illusztráció"21 éves vagyok, és tervezőgrafikával foglalkozom. Főként illusztráció a szakterületem. Ezeket használom fel a többi tervezőgrafikai műfajban is, mint például csomagolás design, magazin layout, vagy jelen esetben a képregény."https://www.facebook.com/ScarecrowsDesignBorbás Róbert - illusztráció"Yo!
Borbas Robi vagyok, aka Grindesign.
Tetoválóként dolgozom három éve, ezt megelőzően illusztrációval foglalkoztam. Elsősorban póló és lemezborító illusztrációkkal.
Remélem elkészülök a munkákkal az ígért határidőig!"https://www.facebook.com/theartofgrindesignBrunszkó László - illusztráció"77 -ben születtem Budapesten.
Graffiti, street art festő, illusztrátorként működöm. Az antológiába pedig illusztrációkat fogok készíteni."https://www.facebook.com/pages/Nikon-One/256213631102083Dömös Zsuzsanna - író"Azóta élek a betűk világában, hogy kiskoromban megismerkedhettem a fantasztikus Szerencsekerék című műsorral, ez pedig akkora nyomot hagyott bennem, hogy a betűvetés azóta kenyérszerző tevékenységemmé vált. Szabadúszó újságíróként web, technológia és informatika témákban írok jelenleg több helyre is, többen azonban csak a PC Guru "Lor"-jaként ismernek, aki videojátékokat szed ízeire és sok-sok kávét iszik (néha annyit, hogy már tikkel a szeme). http://pcguru.hu; http://ign.huKorcsmáros László - rajzoló"22 éves vagyok, a Moholy-Nagy Művészeti Egyetemen járok tervezőgrafika szakra, emellett van egy Trusting nevű straight edge hardcore zenekarom. Úgy alakult, hogy véletlenül írtam egy regényt, azután még kettőt, és mindjárt kezdem a következőt. Persze még nem adtam fel ezt a képregényesdit."https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lakatos-Istv%C3%A1n/513025105429104Nagy Viktor - videóhttps://www.facebook.com/mihasznafilmPintér Márk - rajzoló"Elsősorban illusztrációval és képregényekkel, emellett pedig animációval foglalkozom. story:
My SUMMARY For YOU! :)

  • Hi everyone! My name is BELLE! I am 22 yrs old and was born to be an artist! Honestly I'm an artist of music, poetry, writting, to music and etc. I do various of art that expresses the way I think and see the world. I am a very outgoing person who takes the time to listen and see each person's perspective view of this world! The first time I remember drawing was Blossom- from PowerPuff Girls! I was super excited for I was like 3 years old and really into drawing! I am adventurous and have traveled from Puerto Rico, Honduras, California, and various states in the US. My background of being an artist has really started when I was in Fifth grade! I was so fascinated on how some artist can make a painting come to life! They were so professional in making a piece of art look so real as if you were able to just touch it! I searched so many different artists and their tips on how to do art! Then my creativity really took off! In high school I had an amazing Art Teacher that saw in me more than what I could even see! She pushed me hard in art and I am to this day very grateful! Now I do commissions from Pets to Portraits, to cartoons, and more! This is where my introduction of this Campaign starts!
  • This Campaign honestly its to be able to print my first Comic Book! I currently have all of my comic books digitally so having a physical copy will make my year! Not only will it make my year but it will make me happy that all that supported me will receive a physical copy as well! I've been working hard as an artist trying to figure out how to make it as an artist! Honestly it's hard but having great supporters like YOU helps artists like me be able to accomplish their creative goals! I really want this Comic Book to take off and it really means a lot to me!  
  • By contributing you will help me achieve this huge hurdle to get into the comic book industries! I do have several comic shop already lined up that are wanting my comic book in display and by YOU helping me get my comic book printed I will be able to have my 1st comic book in display! Not only that! But you will help me achieve going to conventions with something more than just artwork! You will help me take something so special to me- the comic book- and I will want to talk about every single one of you that has helped me accomplish my Comic Book Campaign!

Your Help and What you will Receive!

  • This Campaign is very clear the funds are going to be for printing and shipping! I need $500 to print a small run of my comic books! the $500 will go for printing and shipping for me to receive the comic books!
  • This is where you come into play! By contributing into this campaign you will NOT LEAVE empty handed! You will receive the least a thank you email and the most perks that include a comic book, an art print, stickers, and etc. ! No matter what you donate you will receive something directly from me it can be from digital or by mail! BUT it is 100% guarantee you will receive a email, or physical perk!
  • There would be extra perks added to each perk package if the funding doubles of what I am asking for! So the more the Campaign is funded the more perks will be added to You! I've got 3 levels of extra perks! - Level 1) Double the amount asked for! - Level 2) Triple the amount asked for! - Level 3) It quadruples the amount I've asked for! So please spread the word around! :) 

Your IMPACT in ME!

  • My comic book will make a difference to everyone! You rarely see a comic book that focuses on reality but still has a humor to it! It's an open minded comic book that every adults or even high schoolers, or colleagues go through? What am I going to do in life? What lifestyle do I belong or is there any lifestyle out there that I can be apart of?! 
  • I've done several artworks that relate to people from being extremely hurt by someone, to being alone, depressed, deep in thought, and lost! 
  • In this comic book not only is there a story about being in the coffee shop and talking about life but there will be different add-on stories-short stories about scenarios that everyone in some point in their life could relate! At the end of the comic book there will be humor! "Funny- humor"! Not only would you laugh but you will get to know who I am!

Risks & Challenges I FACE!

  • Honestly this hurdle that I have in front of me is to be able to get this creative story printed! Everyone I am a full-time artist but I am a full-time mother and I do have a full-time job! Being able to stay at home with my child means the world to me! There are challenges we all face! Honestly! But there are people that are so kind and supportive that see beyond my art and see who I truly am! I am a hard worker and the biggest hurdle for me right now is financing my projects! With YOUR help it will make a difference not only in my life but will affect tremendously in such a positive way in those that have a relationship with me! 
  • If I don't get this funded I will save money in the littlest things I can! And I will someday get my dream accomplished! If you are able to make a big impact in my life by supporting and helping me reach this goal you will be part of my successful life in my creative world! 
  • Other Ways You Can Help
  • Spread the word! Please if you land in my indegogo campaign please copy link and paste! Spreading the word is the best tool there is! YOU make a great impact and BY YOU spreading the word YOU are helping me reach my goal! 
  • You are welcome to use the Indiegogo tool to share! <3

Thank you so much for taking your time in reading this message! 

 

Sincerely,

BELLE

story:
What is Em is for Monsters?


Em Is for Monsters is a comic set in a world not unlike our own—but appearances can be deceiving. In truth, we live in the shadow of another world. Monsters walk among us, and have infiltrated human society in its entirety. Some are shrewd businessmen, others are shambling monstrosities driven by instinct alone; yet all are united unto a singular end: the daily harvest of mortal souls, the currency of Hell. Mankind continues unaware, shrugging off its losses as fate or chance. No such rationalizations come to the minds of children, however, who can see in their nightmarish totality the monsters for what they are. Em is one such child. A kid like any other, obsessed with dinosaurs, but burdened with a thirst for knowledge that lands her in an underworld of trouble.

Follow our plucky protagonist on her murderous misadventures as she collides with Hell’s legions in a bid for mankind’s salvation.

Plus minus thirty pages of beautiful, full-colour illustrations, Em Is for Monsters is a fast-paced, action-packed romp of a read.
 
Back it on Indiegogo today!



Stephen Spinas is a freelance graphic designer, illustrator and comic book artist from Cape Town, South Africa. Over the last decade, his works have featured in a number of novels, album covers, comic books, audiobooks, advertising campaigns and product labels. A dedicated Twitch streamer, Stephen has also featured on a number of Twitch channels, including UGCZA

Em is for Monsters is an idea that has been in the works for close to three years now, but he needs your help to finish it! As a freelance artist, Stephen’s passion for comic books often has to be set aside, and the grueling hours needed to do justice to such an endeavor become harder to find. Your support will allow him to dedicate his undivided attention to Em is for Monsters, and to create a project he believes you’ll love as much as he does!

(Preview of first page.)

The nitty-gritty:

In order to work on Em is for Monsters full-time, Stephen will need to hit a target of $9990. This will go toward covering the costs of the various perks, merchandise, shipping, administrative fees, living expenses and the printing of the comic itself. The risks associated with setting aside freelance work during this period are considerable, but successfully attaining the target will go a long way toward alleviating the reservations that any artist has when setting out on a new venture. Aside from the financial risk, there are a number of challenges that Em is for Monsters must overcome before seeing the light of day. First, it is imperative that the prints are of the highest quality. This has, in part, contributed toward the necessary target. In order to ensure that the comic meets the expectations of both the artist and the backers, 115gsm paper will be used for the printing. A higher grade material than the industry standard, Em is for Monsters will be a feast for the eyes! Secondly: Deadlines! Deadlines! Deadlines! The comic book will, upon completion, be just over thirty pages. Taking on such a project by oneself is a daunting task, and could take months, even years to complete if one was unable to focus fully upon it. Being able to work on Em is for Monsters full time will, of course, play a huge role in the completion and success of the comic, and it will be all thanks to you!

(Page roughs and line work previews.)
 

The little things: 


Living in South Africa, while amazing, has its drawbacks. Each one of the backing tiers comes with a number of perks. Some of these perks include merchandise. While the merchandise itself can and will be ordered in bulk to keep costs down, shipping and couriering samples can be costly, especially when amendments need to be made. While many manufacturers cover the shipping of samples themselves, this is not always the case. These same shipping costs, which will be absorbed by the project, will add up when it comes to shipping the comic book and perks to you, the excited backer!

While Em is for Monsters is Stephen’s project, finding someone to put his thoughts into words was always going to be a challenge. Fortunately, having done work for indie publishing house Sentinel Creatives, he was able to rope author Mitchell Luthi into the project. Writing and editing costs, while relatively low compared to comparable projects, are a necessity and add to “the little things” that any campaign must take into account.

Creating a comic from start to finish is an herculean task, but sometimes the hardest part is getting the exposure necessary to fund a campaign. A small budget will be dedicated toward advertising, as well as toward promotions at the various conventions in South Africa during this time. That doesn’t mean you can’t help with promoting this campaign! Sharing panels, concept art, links or even just a mention in conversation will go a long way to making this all a success.


Costs and expenses:

 

The Perks:

Perk imagery is for display purposes only some of the artwork is not finalized and is subject to change. Final designs of all merchandise will be updated through the updates section.

 

Perk information:

Gallery for art print perks available on https://www.artofscs.com 

(Personal portraits not available)

Pins and Magnets are picked by the backer from the following choices: 

(More designs may be added at a later time.) 

 

Stretch goals:

I have set up various stretch goal options:

Bonus pack 1: $11000
EIFM Sock pack

Bonus pack 2: $13000
2x EIFM Sock pack
Playmat/Mouse Pad

Bonus Pack 3: $15000
2x EIFM Sock pack
Playmat/Mouse Pad
Custom EIFM Tamagotchi cover + Tamagotchi

Bonus back 4: $20000
3x EIFM Sock pack
Playmat/Mouse Pad
Custom EIFM Tamagotchi cover + Tamagotchi
EIFM Dino backpack

Super Stretch Goal: $30000
Emily 8-10" Statue

 


Deadline:

The deadline for the comic book completion is May, With a successful campaign that deadline will be met with time for a launch at MCM in London, and all products will be shipped as soon as the merchandise is manufactured.
 

Sign up to the mailing list:

For updates to be mailed to you directly regarding all the Sentinel creatives products become a part of our mailing list by clicking the image below.


 

Watch the comic being created live:
Click the image below

Join us on Discord:

Click the image below
story_txt:
What is Em is for Monsters?
Em Is for Monsters is a comic set in a world not unlike our own—but appearances can be deceiving. In truth, we live in the shadow of another world. Monsters walk among us, and have infiltrated human society in its entirety. Some are shrewd businessmen, others are shambling monstrosities driven by instinct alone; yet all are united unto a singular end: the daily harvest of mortal souls, the currency of Hell. Mankind continues unaware, shrugging off its losses as fate or chance. No such rationalizations come to the minds of children, however, who can see in their nightmarish totality the monsters for what they are. Em is one such child. A kid like any other, obsessed with dinosaurs, but burdened with a thirst for knowledge that lands her in an underworld of trouble.
Follow our plucky protagonist on her murderous misadventures as she collides with Hell’s legions in a bid for mankind’s salvation.
Plus minus thirty pages of beautiful, full-colour illustrations, Em Is for Monsters is a fast-paced, action-packed romp of a read. Back it on Indiegogo today!
Stephen Spinas is a freelance graphic designer, illustrator and comic book artist from Cape Town, South Africa. Over the last decade, his works have featured in a number of novels, album covers, comic books, audiobooks, advertising campaigns and product labels. A dedicated Twitch streamer, Stephen has also featured on a number of Twitch channels, including UGCZA
Em is for Monsters is an idea that has been in the works for close to three years now, but he needs your help to finish it! As a freelance artist, Stephen’s passion for comic books often has to be set aside, and the grueling hours needed to do justice to such an endeavor become harder to find. Your support will allow him to dedicate his undivided attention to Em is for Monsters, and to create a project he believes you’ll love as much as he does!
(Preview of first page.)

story:
What is Eternal? Who are we? Read on...

Hi, my name is Jason Micciche, the writer and co-creator of Eternal! I've been writing about video games and comics for well over a decade, but now I want to craft my own story. 

Fortunately, so does my good friend, professional concept artist Greg Semkow. Greg has worked for some of the biggest entertainment companies around, in both film and video games. He has an incredibly cinematic style, and can build worlds that portray everything from post-apocalyptic nightmares to alien landscapes with vistas beyond imagination.

Now he's come up with a story with Eternal that is just begging to be told. It's a melding of all of the above, with a deep mystery at its core. Eternal is a violent vision of a far off world that harbors cosmic secrets and long dead, eerily human civilizations, and also one where armies of human colonists have been cut off from home. Stranded, many attempt to forge a new life and fight just to survive, while others war over the technology hidden in the ruins of the ancients. Some believe it may hold the key to returning home, while others seek to claim the power of the gods for themselves. 

If you think that sounds cool, wait till you hear about the way this bad boy is put together. Eternal will be a 180 page hardcover art book, featuring highly detailed, full-color illustrations printed on gloss coated paper. We like to think of it almost as if you're holding a summer blockbuster right in your hands.

Since Greg is a concept artist, he's no stranger to huge, sweeping visuals. To that end, each illustration in Eternal is going to be a gigantic double-page spread. Where's the story? It'll be printed right on the images themselves, so your eyes never have to leave the artwork, creating the most immersive experience possible.

Here's a taste of what's to come...

The above images are actual mockups of the book's pages. Story elements are unobtrusive, yet easy to read. Each one frames the action in the image, guiding the story and also leading the reader ever further into the Eternal universe. The alien landscapes presented here are absolutely massive, with radically different locations and exciting characters and themes. 

Eternal is a breathtaking new world packed with ancient mysteries, alien creatures, warlords, vigilantes, and battles fought on scales both epic and deeply personal. The power to shape the universe itself is at stake, and only the strong will reign Eternal!

 

Publishing isn't easy, but it can be fun

To get all of this rolling to press, we need at least $15k USD. That might seem like a lot, but it actually includes a lot. For starters, that'll get the book printed up, but then it'll also take care of the shipping to get it out to every one of you, our backers.

We've chosen a terrific publishing company who looks to do stunning work. We know you're going to love the results of what a top flight printer can do with Greg's visuals.

On top of the basic package, we've also got some excellent perks planned. We've kept the tiers to a minimum, but they're all pretty great (if we do say so ourselves).

PERKS

  • BASIC PACK: Includes a hardcover copy of Eternal plus the campaign exclusive splipcase.

  • POSTER PACK: Includes a hardcover copy of Eternal, the slipcase, plus an 18 x 24" poster.

  • STARMAP PACK: Includes a copy of Eternal, the slipcase, the poster, plus a high quality, 7" replica of an ancient Starmap, a key relic from the Eternal universe.
  • ETERNAL PACK: Includes everything that you see above plus a private art commission of either a single character or environment from artist Greg Semkow. Give Greg a detailed design brief (with a PG-13 rating), and he'll do the rest. The final artwork will be delivered as both a digital version and a high quality art print.

 

In addition to that, we've also got some cool stretch goals set up, to make Eternal even bigger and badder. 

STRETCH GOALS

$17,500 - The Eternal Universe grows with extra content

At this level of funding, we'll be including added content that will serve to further explore the world of Eternal. Unseen in the core story, these additional pages will give you a more detailed look at the settlements that struggle to survive on the harsh planet's surface.

$20,000 - Things to come

If we hit this level of funding in the campaign, we'll add a special look at what's to come for both Eternal and other Next Evolution Creative projects.

 

As you can see, we obviously want to get Eternal fully funded. We've got a ton planned and really want to see it excel. But even if we don't hit our final goal, we're going to try to get this done anyway. That's why we've selected the flex funding option. If we're close to the goal line when the campaign wraps, we're going to try to make this happen regardless of the end goal.

And if not? Well, we'd rather not think that way, but if we're not in the ballpark, we'll refund any contribution you've made right back to you.

 

Your pledge makes all the difference

If you've used IndieGoGo before to back projects, then you know the difference that your pledge makes. We're dying for the world to see what we've cooked up with Eternal, and we really do think it's something special. The only way that this book can get into your hands though, is for genre fans like yourself to step forward and lend a hand.

Your agreement to back our project will bring our bold, new sci-fi world to life, and also put it on the road to other things. As I mentioned, we have a lot of ideas for the universe that we're building. This first book is just the start of a much larger adventure.

Your pledge will set all of that in motion. And of course, it'll also get you a phenomenal book, plus a few extras if you go for one of the higher tiers and we start hitting those stretch goals.

                                                

Potential stumbling blocks

In any IGG campaign, there are potential challenges. However, in the case of Eternal we've worked to eliminate almost everything. It was incredibly important to us to get as much done before the campaign even began as possible.

As it is, the majority of the work on Eternal is done. And the publishing end of things has already been set up, along with all of the perks. So we're well on our way already for our projected May 2020 ship date.

That said, could things still go wrong somewhere? Possibly. If things do run errant though, we're confident that we have the tools and connections to correct the course. If we get the campaign close to our goal, it's full steam ahead.

 

Can't back, but still want to help?

So what if you can't contribute to the campaign, but you like the look of Eternal and would like to assist? Well, you definitely can. We'd love for you to share Eternal's campaign as far and wide as possible. This is pretty easy to do, and takes only a second. In fact, IndieGoGo even has built-in tools for you to make use of to share Eternal right across your social media.

Raising awareness of a project is the biggest issue that campaigns have to deal with. So any help in getting the word out is greatly appreciated!

story:
What is The God Dream?

  The famous allegory of Plato's cave suggests that we, as observers, are ignorant to the true nature of reality. He compares the world we experience as shadows of the true world. What is it that casts those shadows? The Paragons. The Paragons are sitting court members of the Perennial Kingdom (the true reality that exists beyond our realm of understamding). They are the foundation to all of societiy's institutions. Concepts like banking, war, and religion, have been brought back from the kingdom to earth by those who had the misfortune of communing with these creatures and managed to maintain their sanity. In this series we will look throughout history at various character accounts of encounters with the Paragons. Each installment will be like a puzzle piece revealing more about the nature of the world and the mysterious Perennial King of The Dream. This first installment introduces The Great Abomination. It is 31 pages, though I may add some bonus pages.

I am having fun creating this world, but I don't want to explore it alone so come for the ride!

Format

The format and style of storytelling I use is different than you might be used to. There are no speech bubbles. We will explore the world through character accounts given at the beginning of each installment via journal entries and other writing. This gives the stories a "found footage" feel that is reminiscent of the way stories are told in video games. The carefully drawn pages are square, plain, and have 1-4 panels. I will also include suggested songs to listen to during your read. many of these songs were what I listened to for inspiration as I wrote each story. Its a unique viewing experience I assure you! 

Here are some finished pages,

The abyss of space

Enter the dream

The Great Abomination

 

Business

The book is already halfway done, and will be finished by December. The money you contribute goes directly to printing and shipping costs. Im covering the cost of the artwork. I started this campaign to give others the opportunity to get a copy of the book and be a part of creating the mythos. It's a simple campaign without all the confusion.

If we don't reach our goal you get your money back! there is no risk to you!

Switch it up!

This project is is unique. I haven't been able to find anything like it on the market. By contributing you help reinforce the much needed variety of storytelling in illustrated media.

Updates

As you can see from my campaign, I keep thinks simple. I create covers for my projects last which is why you don't see one yet. Im not making you sit through a crudely made video by me either. This is a simple project and campaign without that many moving parts. However, if any issues are encountered I will keep all of my contributors informed 100%.

Risks & Challenges

Im paying for the art work out of pocket. I was going to do this as a personal project, but I've decided to invite you along for the journey. The risks and challenges I face are minimal. Im partnering up with reliable fulfillment services to ensure you get your product.

If you have any friends you want to invite to the party they are welcome!
