story:
THE STORY

In the universe, there are entities that know the secrets of existence. They move between doors. These mystical beings appear at very specific times and coexist with us, most of us never knowing they were there.

In the year 3043, one of the entities arrives. Previously known as BUDDHA, he's now possessor of one of the gems of the universe. Today, a group of time-traveling space raiders tried to steal it.

Join these time-traveling thieves as they try to rip a vital gem of the universe from Buddha in a Big Bang Brawl of epic proportions. Find out who comes out on top in this 48 page, fully-illustrated comic.

All those who contribute will receive a digital certificate, which will be foliated, in this way your great contribution will be recognized for helping jumpstart this project.

THE BOOK

Gem Heist: Big Bang Buddha is a 48-page, fully-illustrated comic that comes in two variants one of which is a wraparound cover. There's 22 pages of story, 10 illustrations by fellow artists, and 15 sketch pages.

PERKS

Brave Pirate (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - $8

Included Items:

  • Gem Heist #1 (Digital)

You'll get a digital copy of Gem Heist #1 (48 pages) and a big thanks from the entire crew.

Custom Pirate (DIGITAL) - $40 - limited to 30 buccaneers

Included Items:

  • Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
  • Custom Pirate (Digital)

We'll craft a custom pirate just for you, all based on answers you provide for the survey we send to you at the end of the campaign. You'll receive a digital trading card of your pirate with stats and other background info. You'll also get a digital copy of Gem Heist #1. NOTE: These are all digital items.

Hardened Mercenary (BOOK & PRINT - NUMBERED) - $20

Included Items:

  • Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
  • 5x7 Holofoil Print
  • Gem Heist #1 (Print Copy)

You'll get a print copy of Gem Heist #1 with two variant covers to choose from, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, and music to enjoy the comic with.

Tireless Corsair (HEAVY METAL - NUMBERED) - $50

Included Items:

  • Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
  • Gem Heist #1 Metal Variant
  • 5-Pack of Stickers
  • 5x7 Metal Print

You'll get a print copy of Gem Heist #1 with a Metal cover and two variant designs to choose from, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, a 5-pack of stickers, and music to enjoy the comic with.

Honorary Pirate (HEAVY METAL - NUMBERED) $50 - limited to 16 spots

  • Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
  • Gem Heist #1 Metal Variant
  • 5-Pack of Stickers
  • Comic Page Sponsorship
  • 5x7 Metal Print

Not only will you get a print copy of Gem Heist #1 with a Metal cover and two variant designs to choose from, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, a 5-pack of stickers, and music to enjoy the comic with, you'll also get your name at the bottom of the page "This page was made possible by the sponsorship of [YOUR NAME]."

King of the 7 Seas (HEAVY METAL - NUMBERED - COMBO) - $90

Included Items:

  • Gem Heist (Digital)
  • 5-Pack of Stickers
  • Gem Heist Metal Standard
  • Gem Heist Metal Buddha
  • 5x7 Metal Print

You get both Metal cover variants of Gem Heist, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, a 5-pack of stickers, and music to enjoy the comic with.

Gem Heist Team (THE NUMBER 1s - STANDARD) - $40 (ONLY 1 AVAILABLE)​

Included Items:

  • 5x7 Holofoil Print
  • 5-Pack of Stickers
  • Gem Heist Standard No. 1
  • Gem Heist Buddha No. 1

Because all standard covers are numbered, we wanted to make it easy for the first backer to secure the first copy of each standard variant cover. If you pledge for this tier, you''ll get a total of two print copies of Gem Heist #1, each with the standard and wraparound cover variants, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, a 5-pack of stickers, and music to enjoy the comic with. NOTE: If you want THE NUMBER 1s in Metal, see below.

Forger Team (THE NUMBER 1s - HEAVY METAL) - $90 (ONLY 1 AVAILABLE)​

Included Items:

  • Gem Heist (Digital)
  • 5x7 Holofoil Print
  • 5-Pack of Stickers
  • Gem Heist No. 1 Metal Buddha
  • Gem Heist No. 1 Metal Standard

Because all Metal covers are numbered and limited, we wanted to make it easy for the first backer to secure the first copy of each Metal variant cover. If you pledge for this tier, you''ll get a total of two print copies of Gem Heist #1, each with the standard and wraparound Metal cover variants, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, a 5-pack of stickers, and music to enjoy the comic with. NOTE: Only 1 available.

Creator God of the Universe (YOU'RE IN THE COMIC) - $200 - limited to 5 spots

Included Items:

  • Custom character (appears in comic)
  • Gem Heist (Digital)
  • 5-Pack of Stickers
  • Gem Heist Metal Standard
  • Gem Heist Metal Buddha
  • 5x7 Metal Print

You appear in the comic! Once the campaign ends, we'll send you a survey to get some basic details so we can craft your custom character. You'll also get both Metal cover variants of Gem Heist, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, a 5-pack of stickers, and music to enjoy the comic with.

 

ADD-ONS

You can add any of these items to your order after you select your perk.

  • Poster 16x20 - Standard Cover - $18
  • Poster 16x20 - Big Bang Buddha Cover -$18

  • BARK BITE BATTLE print copy - $10 - A 6-page comic that follows private investigator Apollo, a former drug-sniffing dog who's having a hard time making it through life after serving the black and blue for so long.

STRETCH GOALS

$1000 - All tiers will get a digital copy of BARK BITE BATTLE starring private investigator Apollo.

Comic Interior 22 Comic Pages 

 

10 Artists Collaboration

BalamComic has some great friends, cartoonists and colorists, artists who have worked on Valiant comics, Zenescope Entertainment, Heavy Metal Magazine and more. They provided some incredible illustrations of Gem Heist that are part of the 1st issue.

DC Alonso

Hedwin Zaldivar

Alberto Hernandez

 

The Pirate Team

  • BalamComic - Creator/Artist
  • My Bro, logistic.
  • Bleu Riddle - Collaborator

BalamComic

"I am Francisco Balam but everyone knows me as BalamComic. I’m a person who left everything to achieve my dream, drawing comics. I’m a comic artist, streamer and podcaster.

As a streamer on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer and Periscope, I share my work processes and talk with other artists and creators.

I have my Podcast on iTunes, Spotify, Google Podcast and more. In the talk with cartoonists, we talk about its beginnings and its life story. BalamComic was nominated at the Latin Podcast Awards for best podcast in Mexico and best podcast for art in 2018."

  • Spotify - Link to Spotify
  • iTunes - Link to iTunes
  • Whooska - Link to player
  • Main Website - https://balamcomic.com/podcast/

Reviews from BalamComic's Clients

FIVERR

https://www.fiverr.com/balamcomic
story_txt:
THE STORYIn the universe, there are entities that know the secrets of existence. They move between doors. These mystical beings appear at very specific times and coexist with us, most of us never knowing they were there.In the year 3043, one of the entities arrives. Previously known as BUDDHA, he's now possessor of one of the gems of the universe. Today, a group of time-traveling space raiders tried to steal it.Join these time-traveling thieves as they try to rip a vital gem of the universe from Buddha in a Big Bang Brawl of epic proportions. Find out who comes out on top in this 48 page, fully-illustrated comic.All those who contribute will receive a digital certificate, which will be foliated, in this way your great contribution will be recognized for helping jumpstart this project.THE BOOKGem Heist: Big Bang Buddha is a 48-page, fully-illustrated comic that comes in two variants one of which is a wraparound cover. There's 22 pages of story, 10 illustrations by fellow artists, and 15 sketch pages.PERKSBrave Pirate (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - $8Included Items:Gem Heist #1 (Digital)You'll get a digital copy of Gem Heist #1 (48 pages) and a big thanks from the entire crew.Custom Pirate (DIGITAL) - $40 - limited to 30 buccaneersIncluded Items:
Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
Custom Pirate (Digital)
We'll craft a custom pirate just for you, all based on answers you provide for the survey we send to you at the end of the campaign. You'll receive a digital trading card of your pirate with stats and other background info. You'll also get a digital copy of Gem Heist #1. NOTE: These are all digital items.Hardened Mercenary (BOOK & PRINT - NUMBERED) - $20Included Items:
Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
5x7 Holofoil Print
Gem Heist #1 (Print Copy)
You'll get a print copy of Gem Heist #1 with two variant covers to choose from, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, and music to enjoy the comic with.Tireless Corsair (HEAVY METAL - NUMBERED) - $50Included Items:
Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
Gem Heist #1 Metal Variant

5x7 Metal Print

Gem Heist #1 (Digital)
Gem Heist #1 Metal Variant
5-Pack of Stickers
Comic Page Sponsorship
5x7 Metal Print

Gem Heist (Digital)

5x7 Holofoil Print
5-Pack of Stickers
Gem Heist Standard No. 1
Gem Heist Buddha No. 1
Because all standard covers are numbered, we wanted to make it easy for the first backer to secure the first copy of each standard variant cover. If you pledge for this tier, you''ll get a total of two print copies of Gem Heist #1, each with the standard and wraparound cover variants, a 5x7 Chrome Holofoil Print, a digital copy, a 5-pack of stickers, and music to enjoy the comic with. story: MR Stash is a conceptual graphic novel written by Elisa Perea and drawn by Bad Balmain. Inspired by One Piece, this cyberpunk story is just a purpose by now. The whole world has succumbed under the control of Joker, a clown who tricked all nations to dominate the entire globe. He knows absolutely everything that happens in the world because he owns the most powerful weapons defense technology in the world. With this technology he do whatever he wants. In the midst of misery, a cyborg opposes the tyranny of Joker and decides to fight against the cybercrime caused by the greatest tyrant known by long. His name is Mr. Stash, the hope of mankind. By helping this campaign to become a reality, you will receive a 44-page inked book and lots of surprises by now! We will posting some progress to see the final product. Thanks to everybody who had helped this dream!

story:
Happy New Year Everybody!!!

We have delivered to all our Backers and are now selling directly through SmashAndRun.com. The journey continues!!! The SMASH AND RUN TEAM wish you a great 2018.

First come, first served. We just delivered to the first 27 Backers! Place your order while supplies last, but new supplies will be ordered soon to deliver in January. 

Check out the Updates tab above, and feel free to leave a Comment.

New logo:

Check out the Updates tab above, and feel free to leave a Comment.

Short Summary

Hi, my name is Ian Eyre. I've been working in entertainment since college. For the last twenty-five years I’ve worked in special effects and stunts for pay, and studied screenwriting, producing and directing as a dream. As you can see in my Stunt Performing Reel, I put a lot of heart and soul into pounding the ground. And as you can see from my award-winning short film “Run Cholo Run”, I want to tell high-octane, human stories. I'm putting that same passion and creativity into my comics and movies. Click here for Eyre Films Newsletter.

The Comic

To prove an audience for the the exciting world of SMASH AND RUN,  I decided to start sharing the story through a comic book. Unfortunately, my amazing artist Alan Reyes had to take a break. I've assembled a new team to help me complete the comic and we're taking pre-orders on the first issue. We need funds to pay the artists, marketing and print costs, Indiegogo fees, taxes, etc. You're going to want to run, jump and Parkour to get your own comic!

          

Smash and Run the comic series will tell the back stories of some of the characters in the movie. The first issue will be called SMASH AND RUN: CHOOSING SIDES, because since it will be the first published exposure to the world, you the audience won’t necessarily know who's good and who’s bad. Actually, the hero just runs and flips through life and hasn’t decided yet which side to take. Whose side do you choose?

The Hero

Our hero is called Flacco by his mom because he’s so skinny. He prefers to be called Falco because he dreams of flying like a falcon. He trains in the art of Parkour a.k.a. Freerunning in order to experience the freedom of flight, but also to face and overcome his fear of heights. If only he could stay focused and commit to each jump without getting distracted by girls. When his family storefront is robbed by smash-and-grab robbers, he decides that he wants in on the action - the chase. If the cops can’t catch ‘em, and he can’t  join ‘em, maybe he can beat ‘em.

So, what is Freerunning a.k.a. Parkour?

First, a quick recap of what's so awesome about the growing sport. 

And this guy explains the difference: 

\
 
Freerunning isn't just for superheroes, there's something for all ages and abilities. It's a great workout, it forces you to push your own boundaries, it inspires confidence in life, and it keeps you feeling young. You're going to want to jump into the world of SMASH AND RUN.
 

The Movie

Ian wrote a movie that we're really excited about called SMASH AND RUN, which is basically Fast and Furious on foot with teenager crime-fighters. 

          

SMASH AND RUN is a father/son story set inside a diamond heist-story, located in multi-cultural Koreatown near downtown Los Angeles, with lots of original Freerunning action scenes. The teenager doesn't much respect his mom's new husband because he has no idea of the sacrifice the father-figure made out of love for his mom. So, he keeps pushing boundaries and tying to prove himself, just like we all do, right? But in his case, that means chasing down robbers himself instead of letting the cops do it.


 

The Crowdfund Campaign

We're launching a sixty day campaign, through the months of November and December, to raise funds to finish the comic book. We intend to deliver our updated, original, 20 page B&W Comic #1 in December so you can give it as gifts in time for Christmas. Then in January, once the funds get released by Indiegogo, we will get busy coloring Comic #1 and drawing Comic #2. 

The Team 

 

IAN EYRE

Ian Eyre is a writer, director, stunt coordinator who hails from Toronto via Atlanta and settled in Los Angeles with his wife and two pre-teen, Parkour-loving children. His work can be seen at Eyre Films, YouTube and IMDb.

 

JAY JAMES

 

Jay, is a professional martial artist and traceur (Parkour athlete) from Cary North Carolina, who is an American Parkour Ambassador and the founder of Rahyz Cary Fitness, a traveling martial arts and Parkour family. Jay has been involved and training in the Parkour community for over 8 years through teaching, competing, performance, acting, and stunt work. See Jay's video here.

 
 
 
 
AUDRA ESCH
 

Awwdraws /ah-drahs/ noun 1. One who sketches cute or “aww” inducing subjects, particularly persons that go by the name Audra Esch.

Audra has been working in the film and television industry for 12+ years as a storyboard artist. She has a wide range of experience from live action to cg animation with a background in fine art painting in portraiture and landscapes. She loves to work in a range of styles from realistic to cartoony and cute. Currently she is obsessed with painting mermaids. Her tools of the trade include the iPad Pro, various drawing and design apps, a range of red pencils, gouache, watercolor and oil. Audra is a spectacular artist from Phoenix, AZ. See her amazing Paintings and Illustrations. 

 

The Promise

We're on schedule to deliver the first B&W issue of Smash and Run comics in time to give as a Christmas gift. If there's a delay in printing and you really want it by a certain date, let us know and we'll custom print a short order. We've also created some other exclusive perks to reward your support. This comic book is the start of something huge - perhaps one day a major motion picture franchise. Will you help us keep the dream alive?

 

What We Need & What You Get

Initial Goal: $7000 to finish the comic in Color and print 500 copies.

Stretch Goal: we will keep the momentum going with new issues.

Ian is currently paying for this comic book by trading professional skills with other professionals. This is a slow way of spending sweat equity while also paying the bills.

It costs about $100 for a professional artist to draw a page, $50 to color it and $15 to hand letter it. I have chosen Audra Esch to complete drawing Comic #1 because she's so talented and she loves Parkour. The first artist Alan Reyes is super talented as well, but had to take a break. I've also partnered with American Parkour Ambassador Jay James to bring the comic to the Freerunning world. Then, logistically, Indiegogo requires 8% for their services and credit card handling. And we still need to create, package and deliver the products, and pay our taxes.​

We’re dreaming up ways to give back to the community through various youth programs such as The Graff Lab.

The fun thing about starting small is including you fans. Y'all can offer positive suggestions and we can incorporate them into the story and the process. See the Comments section.

BTW, if we don't raise $7000 we get nothing, so we're "all in" to provide you the best comic possible.

The Rewards and Perks (choose confirmed perks on the right):

Please note: The t-shirt options have a choice for adult sizes and child sizes. Obviously, a shirt can't be both. Please simply leave a comment to clarify your choice.

Sorry for the high shipping costs. Those are based on USPS rates. I will continue to research less expensive options. If you're in the social circles of any of the team, you may pick your perk up directly. Or come to the Comic Release Jam in Los Angeles, date TBD in January.

Potential Future Perks - Tell us what you want:

GRAVITY FREE $TBD // LIMITED TO 5

  • Personal Parkour training session (2 hours) with Jay James in Los Angeles, Date TBD

GROUND POUNDER $TBD // LIMITED TO 5

  • Personal Stunt training session (2 hours) with Ian Eyre in Los Angeles, Date TBD

COMIC RELEASE JAM $TBD // LIMITED TO 3

  • ​One ticket to the Comic Release Jam in Los Angeles, TBD.

JAM OR BUST $TBD // LIMITED TO 3

  • ​VIP treatment at a Comic Release Jam in Los Angeles. Help design and build an obstacle course with Jay James (and get some coaching as well).

POINT OF NO RETURN $??? 

  • Make a request. Dream without fear. If you believe in our cause and want to encourage us, make any amount of donation and suggest the perks or rewards you would like. We will create a custom experience for you.

Stretch Goal #1

Comic #2, of course!.

The Impact

Making a living in entertainment is challenging, especially paying the bills in Los Angeles. Creating something of value and delivering it takes risk and perseverance. We’re starting small but dreaming big. As we figure out what you our audience are interested in we will provide options for you to immerse yourself into the world of Smash and Run. This is our first comic book, but it’s just a different medium of storytelling. The award winning “Run Cholo Run” is an example of the quality of product we strive for, complete with original music and artwork. We covet your input, what you like, what you dislike, and what kinds of characters and stories you’d like to see represented.

Eyre Films, LLC is committed to impacting the community as well as the bottom line. Eyre Films, LLC will always give 10% to charities that make the world more beautiful, such as Mosaic LA, a community of faith, love and hope that does the most good locally and worldwide with what it’s entrusted with, and the Act One Program, which trains up storytellers to use the power of entertainment to impact culture positively. The Smash and Run project will also donate 10% of its profits (after we deliver the comic and perks) to youth programs such as American Parkour and The Graff Lab. 

In an entertainment business with shameful elements such as sexual harassment and bullying, we want to set an example of treating humans humanely. We believe that we can counter the motivating forces of fame, fortune and depravity that tarnish Hollywood with positive characteristics such as humility, generosity and goodness. We will entertain you without making you compromise your values.

 

Risks & Challenges

Why make another comic book? Well, it's more fun than reading a book with no pictures right? And there are not too many comics showcasing the fast-growing sport of Freerunning. All the kids are doing it. All the middle schools in Washington, D.C. are teaching it. My eleven-year-old son is wall-climbing my house and jumping off my roof, for crying out loud. And SMASH AND RUN is a story where the kids outperform the grownups. That serves a need, not a desire, right parents? 

I don't have a track record making popular movies or comics, but I think my interests overlap with the interests of millions of people, and that what excites me will excite you. And I think the execution in my reels and short films show that I deliver at a high quality. I'm hiring the right professionals to take what I've started to the next level, and your mailbox.

Making a feature film is like eating a macdaddy elephant - it must be broken into many bite-sized morsels. Writing a good screenplay is like eating a smaller elephant. While rewriting the feature screenplay, I wrote a short script to prove the concept and build fans, but the cost and logistics were still daunting. So, why not a comic book? Not that I want to think about eating a baby elephant. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Would you please share the video and link www.smashandrun.com with your friends?

You can download images to put on your Facebook page here:

Smash and Run web link QR Code:

Smash and Run Avatar image 360x360:

Smash and Run promo image 1200x630:

Smash and Run Facebook off centered image 851x315:

Smash and Run header 1440x500:

Smash and Run FLYER:

 

SHARE THE LOVE ON: 

 www.twitter.com/EyreFilms

 www.facebook.com/SmashAndRunFilm

 www.instagram.com/ianmeyre/

@SmashAndRunFilm

 

And if you give us an awesome soundbite quote, we'll post it here:

 

SMASH AND RUN project supported by APK

We covet your input, what you like, what you dislike, and what kinds of characters and stories you’d like to see represented.
Eyre Films, LLC is committed to impacting the community as well as the bottom line. Eyre Films, LLC will always give 10% to charities that make the world more beautiful, such as Mosaic LA, a community of faith, love and hope that does the most good locally and worldwide with what it’s entrusted with, and the Act One Program, which trains up storytellers to use the power of entertainment to impact culture positively. The Smash and Run project will also donate 10% of its profits (after we deliver the comic and perks) to youth programs such as American Parkour and The Graff Lab. 

In an entertainment business with shameful elements such as sexual harassment and bullying, we want to set an example of treating humans humanely. We believe that we can counter the motivating forces of fame, fortune and depravity that tarnish Hollywood with positive characteristics such as humility, generosity and goodness. We will entertain you without making you compromise your values.
 

Risks & Challenges
Why make another comic book? Well, it's more fun than reading a book with no pictures right? And there are not too many comics showcasing the fast-growing sport of Freerunning. All the kids are doing it. All the middle schools in Washington, D.C. are teaching it. My eleven-year-old son is wall-climbing my house and jumping off my roof, for crying out loud. And SMASH AND RUN is a story where the kids outperform the grownups. That serves a need, not a desire, right parents? 
I don't have a track record making popular movies or comics, but I think my interests overlap with the interests of millions of people, and that what excites me will excite you. And I think the execution in my reels and short films show that I deliver at a high quality. I'm hiring the right professionals to take what I've started to the next level, and your mailbox.
Making a feature film is like eating a macdaddy elephant - it must be broken into many bite-sized morsels. Writing a good screenplay is like eating a smaller elephant. While rewriting the feature screenplay, I wrote a short script to prove the concept and build fans, but the cost and logistics were still daunting. So, why not a comic book? Not that I want to think about eating a baby elephant. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Would you please share the video and link www.smashandrun.com with your friends?
You can download images to put on your Facebook page here:
Smash and Run web link QR Code:

Smash and Run Avatar image 360x360:

Smash and Run promo image 1200x630:
Smash and Run Facebook off centered image 851x315:

Smash and Run header 1440x500:

Smash and Run FLYER:

 
SHARE THE LOVE ON: 
 www.twitter.com/EyreFilms
 www.facebook.com/SmashAndRunFilm
 www.instagram.com/ianmeyre/
@SmashAndRunFilm
 
And if you give us an awesome soundbite quote, we'll post it here:

 
SMASH AND RUN project supported by APK

story:
Hello and thank you for your interest in the Gully & Finch Comic Series! We are psyched you have taken a moment to learn more.

If you're a fan of Detective or Buddy Comics, these two amateur sleuths are sure to keep you entertained with their mishaps and misadventures!

We are raising funds to offset the cost of coloring the Full-Color volume and to print and publish both the 24-page B&W and Full-Color volumes of Gully & Finch Volume 1: The Bachelorette Comic. We have already begun the process and are eager to send the full-color comic out into the world! The B&W digital version went No. 1 within days of being self-published in its category.

We hope you'll read further to see how you can help with this part of the process! We are grateful for any support you may be able to contribute. We realize that not everyone can help fund the project, but there are other ways you can help support our series. Just sharing the campaign with others through FB, Twitter, IG, Reddit, and the like would be a tremendous help! Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

The Creators:

My name is Tonia Kempler. I am a Filmmaker/Screenwriter/Author. My recent accomplishments include multi-award-winning short films and numerous screenwriting accolades. Comics have always been a special passion! Please feel free to visit my websites for more information: writing4em or B3E Entertainment.

I partnered with Norbert Yates, an incredible illustrator, who brought my pages to life. It was an incredible experience to watch my script come together through another's artistic vision. I am both honored to have met him and humbled by his talent. I could not have done this without him. In short, Norbert ROCKS! And together we are going to rock out many more bungled cases for Gully Jessup and Finch Watson!

 

 

 

The Campaign:

I am launching this campaign to raise the funds necessary to bring Gully & Finch to life in a full-color, physical volume. I have personally funded the project to this point and have a No. 1 best-selling black & white digital copy to show for our efforts. All that is left to do is color and print!

The Gully & Finch Comic is based on a lighthearted Television Series and a shorter form web series I am currently pitching to networks and production companies. We had originally planned to start shooting the proof of concept for the web series this past summer, but due to the state of things in our current environment with Covid19, production has been halted until it is safe for the cast & crew to continue. Please feel free to visit the web series website Gully & Finch at your leisure, for more on the series or to follow our production schedule.

The black & white version of the comic is available on Amazon (Kindle Select) and went No. 1 in its category within 5 days of its release, through a major push on Social Media. The Community really showed their belief and support of our comedic duo -- thank you! I have been beyond humbled by everyone's generosity towards this project. We are adding a couple of special bonuses to the B&W digital perk!

With your help, we release the full-color of Gully & Finch!

 

 

The Series:

Gully & Finch is a Comedy/Buddy/Detective Series  about two twenty-somethings, stuck in failure-to-launch mode who pass themselves off as private investigators and start tackling cases they are not cut out for, landing them both in a heap of trouble.  They're a 21st Century Hardy Boys meets Veronica Mars & beloved classic detective icons: Magnum, Sherlock, Jim Rockford, and more!

 

 

 

What We Need:

The following is what we would like to raise through the campaign:

  • Our goal is to raise $12,500.00.
  • We do have some really creative stretch goals coming up! (TBA alongside updates as we near our target goal).
  • It is our aim to off-set color and printing costs for both the B&W and Full-Color volume (We are already underway!)
  • The remainder will cover publishing and distribution of the actual comic book, along with the cost associated with fulfilling our Perks.

 

My Commitment:

The Gully & Finch Universe was inspired by my little bro and some truly funny real-life scenarios. This entire endeavor is dedicated to him!

  • I will absolutely complete this project even if we don't reach our entire goal. It will just take a little longer without investors.
  • We will ship copies of the book (and all merchandise) timely but may have to work around the printing facility's schedule due to any unforeseen circumstances that could arise due to Covid19. Information will be timely with precise details.
  • I will keep the updates on this project coming and I promise to make them fun!

 

 

 

 

A Few of the Perks:

  • Both the B&W and Full-Color versions of Volume 1: The Bachelorette will be an available perk.
  • We'll feature a few investors as Illustrated Character Cameos in the comic (limited perk). This perk also makes a perfect surprise gift! A character will be crafted from a photo of the investor's choice.
  • We will be offering a Creative Q&A  Session with the Creator of the series via Zoom.
  • Join in on a brainstorming session for Volume 2 with the Creator and additional writers.
  • Fun Merchandise and varient covers will be available as stretch goals and MORE!

 

 

 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

There really are no risks! The heavy lifting has already been done. I have already covered layout design, pencils, and inks! And I have a best-selling comic to prove my dedication to this project. 

I am committed to seeing all of my projects through. I guarantee every order will be filled and updates will be generated timely. If you already follow me on social media, then you are aware of my dedication to my craft and my projects. My success and momentum speak volumes for my tenacious work ethic!

The only challenge I can foresee would be the time it would take to complete the project on my own if the funds are not raised. I am committed to publishing the full-color version and will get it done without fail. It would be mega fantastic to have the partnership of backers behind us!

Imagine how rewarding it will be to know you were behind this project from the beginning! We aren't stopping with a comic. The comic is one part of a much larger Gully & Finch Universe!

During this unstable time with Covid19, we may need to make allowances for facilities to prepare and ship merchandise. So far, all of the vendors we are working with are on point and have not been impacted too badly. Even if this were the case, it would just be a short delay!

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, no problem, you can still help in other ways that are equally valuable:

  • You can share the campaign on your social media pages to help get the word out about our boys and their comic!
  • The more you circulate the campaign page, the more people discover Gully & Finch!
  • PLEASE remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We appreciate your time, more than you know. Just taking a moment to browse this campaign means the world! Thank you in advance for your support!

 

     

     

     

    Follow Us on Social Media!

    Tonia Kempler: Twitter  Instagram  Facebook

    Gully & Finch: Twitter  Facebook

    Gully Jessup: Twitter

    Finch Watkins: Twitter

    Southern Gothic Films: Twitter  Instagram  Facebook

     

     

    TEASER VOL. 2

I have a 3D Printer but its broken for some reason.

with the first few hundred dollars i will buy myself the CR-10 Printer.

Then i need to buy the Filament wich i want to buy in a good Quality 

so its around 50 Dollars per 1Kg for my first armor i will need around 5Kg

of Filament so 250 Dollars. Then i need to buy the silicon to make a

negative of the printed Parts what will be around 300 Dollars for all the

Material and casting of the Parts.

Then after everything is done i need to paint the Parts wich is pretty 

expensive so its around 300 Dollars. 

I would be really Happy if you would help me Reach my Goal :)

story:
I am Onwuekwe Uchenna Stanley, an Illustrator and Scriptwriter from Anambra State Nigeria. This should be my first script on a professional level. The illustrations you see now were done by me for this fundraising campaign. My scripts are ready waiting to be illustrated with hired professional artists.

Ikenga is an African comic book series which is about a group of heroes who use supernatural powers against the Aliens that invade their lands. Some of the heroes go rogue after experiencing the overwhelming Alien technology. The combined powers of Magic and Alien technology make them difficult to defeat.

The comic is action-packed and highly educative of mysteries of some African cultures and values. 

 

Failed experiments by the Imorokos (Aliens) give rise to some grotesque humanoid species that understand just one word. ''Kill.''

 

The prince of Abali Kingdom is known for his mysterious white hair. A trait he acquires from birth. He is a member of Uli fraternity, a group of gifted superheroes who vows to protect the Kingdom from external forces.​

 

Ijele is a masquerade demonic magic wielded by the servants of an Arch witch, the queen of the Evil Forest. The wielder of the power summons a mace by screaming ''IJELE''! 

 

With the Eagle and Bull's eye gift from birth, Obiageli becomes one of the most formidable agents of Uli fraternity. 

 

She is Olajumoke, the daughter of a fallen Invader and war slave. When King Aguiyi discovers that she is the direct descendant of Ogun, the God of Iron, he converts her to his main guard and executioner. Due to her gruesome physical prowess, people call her ''A man with breasts''. 

Isiguzo is Abali Kingdom's most notorious smuggler. After stealing an Oracle from the most sacred Shrine in the Kingdom, the Gods curse him. He becomes an ape-man. However, it never hinders him from using his supernatural powers of size manipulation.

 

Igurube is a midget and one of the founding fathers of Uli fraternity. His source of power is the magic snuff inhaled into his windpipe. With a punch, he can pulverize virtually anything.

My dream has always been to promote African culture through comic books. This promising comic book is a tale that I want to make stand the test of time. 
Your voluntary donations to this project will bring out the best out of it and in the future will influence the growth of Comic books in Africa. 

Based on my personal research, comic book artists charge between $20-$200 per page.

GOALS

$5000 is the goal for Volume one. If the goal is exceeded, the money will be used for publicity and the rest of the volumes. 

The money received from the donations will be used to pay the artist(Penciler and colourist) while I may do the Inking. The agreement depends on the amount raised. 

REWARDS

If you back this project with less than $20, you will be entitled to ''Special thanks'' well written on the first page of the first Episode of volume 1.
Less then $200, you will get FREE Episodes 1 and 2 PDF plus ''Special thanks''.

From $200 and above, you will receive a framed painted and signed illustration of your desired character shipped to you plus FREE Episodes 1 and 2 PDF with ''Special thanks''

The book will be sold as Ebooks on Google Playstore and iOs. However, there will be printed edition on demand. 

For more inquiries, you can find me on Instagram and Twitter @Ikengacomic or by email at drikenga5000@gmail.com.

Thanks as I anticipate your donations.

story:
Help the Widows Come Alive!

Midnight Widows aims to be two things: first, a kick-ass comic book about lesbian vampires versus zombie serial killers; and second, a love-letter to the horror genre in all of its manifestations. Its principal creators are avid horror fans who have drawn upon a wide range of influences from the genre including Gothic literature, German Expressionist cinema, 1950s US horror comics, horror manga, Italian fumetti, zombie movies, 1980s pulp paperback horror and more. We hope that, if you are a horror fan, you will find something to appreciate in Midnight Widows no matter your specific tastes.

The comic has already had a trial run, with the first issue having been serialised in Belladonna magazine in 2017. The time is now right for Midnight Widows to be launched as its own title, and by backing this campaign, you will help us to achieve our initial goal of publishing three issues of the comic. If this campaign is a success, then we plan for future issues to follow, exploring new areas of horror: with your help the Widows can be immortal!

Due to its violence and overall raunchiness, Midnight Widows is recommended for mature readers. 

Sample Pages

 

 

 

 


The Team

Doris V. Sutherland is the writer of Midnight Widows. She has a love for the horror genre in its various manifestations, an affection that she hopes to put to creative ends in building the world of the Widows. As a contributor to the Doctor Who tie-in line from Big Finish, Doris has past experience with quasi-immortal people fighting monsters. You can tweet her @DorVSutherland.

Marcela Hauptvogelova is the inker and colourist on issue 1, and the main artist on issues 2 and 3. Marcela will be your guide to the world of the Widows and the horrors that lurk within.

Rosie Wigg is the main artist on the first issue of Midnight Widows. An animator as well as a comic artist with a range of personal projects on the go, Rosie brings a quirky, distinctive visual style to her chapter in the Widows' story.

Jio Butler is the colourist on issues 2 and 3 of Midnight Widows. Her other projects include Hellicious, a comic series recently published by SBI Press.

Delia Mihai painted the gorgeous cover art for issue 1 and will also be chipping in with issue 3 as a guest artist.

Wendy Browne is co-publisher and will help out with the financial side of the comic.


Stretch Goals

While we have no definite stretch goals, excess money will go towards funding further issues of Midnight Widows.


Risks & Challenges

The team behind Midnight Widows have varying degrees of experience in the field, and a number of factors involved in its completion will be new to us. There is always the chance that things might go wrong, particularly when it comes to printing and distributing physical copies of the comic. However, in the event of delays or other problems, we will strive to keep in touch with every backer affected and ensure that they go away satisfied with their experience.

story:
CAMPAIGN EXTENDED AND NEW TIERS ADDED!

I've extended the campaign to give more people a chance to get in on this great deal!  I have also added some extra tiers for those interested in getting some of my out-of-print limited edition sketchbooks.

(4 Ashcan sized sketchbooks, all out of print and highly collectible)

GABAGE MAN OVERVIEW

Welcome!  My name is Aaron Lopresti and if you just watched the promo video you already know that I have been working in mainstream comics for over 25 years on some of the industry's top titles.  10 years ago I created a monster/hero character called Garbage Man for DC Comics.  Garbage Man was featured in two separate mini-series and developed a committed fanbase and following. Because it was a creator-owned property DC never collected the 120- pages of story in a single volume.  Now that the rights to the character have returned to me, I am doing what they wouldn't. 

Garbage Man is the story of Richard Ethan Morse, an ambitious corporate lawyer who accidentally discovers some illegal activities by his largest client, Titan Pharmaceuticals.  Not wanting to risk exposure, Titan's lead research scientist, Holden Clive, has Morse abducted and used as a guinea pig for his immoral human growth experiments.  The experiments go horribly wrong and the evidence along with Richard Morse are destroyed.  But Richard Morse's chemically altered remains mingle with the refuse from Titan's waste dump and he emerges as Garbage Man. His journey to bring Titan to justice leads him into conflict with other outrageous monsters, all the while trying to rediscover his lost humanity and new purpose for his life.

This Project represents the best work of my career and I am excited to collect it all in one high quality publication but I can't bring it to life without you!  This is fixed amount campaign, so you don't have to worry about paying for something you won't receive.  Over my career, I have prided myself in professionalism and integrity.  You can trust that you will get what you pay for with the highest possible quality and timeliness.  

 

WHAT YOU'RE GETTING

GARBAGE MAN HARDCOVER COLLECTION:  9.5 X 12.5 European-sized approximately 170-page hardcover book. This includes the 120-page original DC Garbage Man saga with an additional 11 pages of new material.  (Since Batman appeared in the original DC version, those pages had to be removed and will be replaced with some of my never before seen characters.  So this your chance to own the first appearance of some heroes you will be seeing again!)   I am also including a chapter of my developmental sketches and designs.  But the major bonus in this collection is an all new 13-page Garbage Man story, written and penciled by me and inked and colored by my original Garbage Man collaborators, Matt Ryan and John Kalisz.

(Art for the  print included in the Limited Edition version of the book.  Work in Progress.  Finished piece will be inked and colored.)

 

PERKS:  There are a few different levels of perks for you to choose from.  There will be a PDF version for those who have no more room for printed material.  There will be the standard edition with everything described above.  There will be a signed/remarque edition, which is the standard edition with my signature along with a small Garbage Man head remarque.  I am also including the option for a limited edition signed and numbered volume that will include a limited edition tipped in color print.  And finally, for those who want it all I am offering the limited edition version with a head sketch drawn in the book!

GET YOUR NAME IN THE BOOK:  Every person contributing to this project will get their name in the back of the book on a contributors page(s).  You will forever be immortalized in the book you helped create!

(Garbage Man pin-up to be inked by Danny Miki for pin-up gallery.  Work in Progress)

 

STRETCH GOALS:  I am offering only two stretch goals. The first will be "unlocked" when the campaign hits the magic number of $40,000.  I will expand the book to include a Garbage Man Pin-Up Gallery by some of the industry's top talent including RON GARNEY, KELLEY JONES, DANNY MIKI, JEROME MOORE  and HILARY BARTA.  These are the artists who have committed so far but there will be more added.  This gallery would be included in all versions of the book. 

The second stretch goal will be an added epilogue to the new Garbage Man story that will introduce a new villain to the ongoing Garbage Man saga.  When we hit the $45,000 mark this 3-page story extra will be added in to all editions of the book.

FINANCIAL GOAL: The amount I need to pull off this rather ambitious project is $35,000.  That might seem like a high number to some but remember the printing costs on a book this large is fairly high.  Also this number includes shipping estimates and the platform fees.  Most importantly,  I am using top industry professionals on this book and don't believe in asking other artists to help out for free.  I need to pay them their normal industry rates, which I am doing.  Despite this, I am not going to over charge you for the product. The price of the standard edition of this book is right in line with what you would pay for a volume of this size in your regular comic shop or bookstore.  Remember this is a fixed rate campaign, so if we don't hit the number you get your money back!  So jump on board and let's make this happen!  

 

PUBLICATION DATE

MAY 2020 or sooner.  Although I am currently working for DC Comics and other publishers I have cleared room in my schedule to begin working on this project the day after the campaign ends.  That being said, since others are contributing and it is impossible to predict the printing time turnaround or any unforeseen delays, I think setting a date of  May 2020 gives me plenty of time to absorb any surprises.  My plan is to get the book out sooner than that but better safe than sorry!

 

ART FROM THE BOOK

The following are samples of some of the art you will see in the book.

story:
Our Story

Red Talon was a dream created many years ago, around 2003-2005 . At first he was called Black Talon and he was actually created by my father, Ken Keller II. I am Ken Keller III and the writer, story-teller and co-creator of the Red Talon universe along with my father. We created Flat World Comics all the way back then but never made it a reality. I spent many years trying to convert our comic book idea into a teen novel; in fact I wrote the novel twice. In the end when I was 23 I decided that the story would be best seen as it was always intended: as a action packed comic book with an original story.

That's what we delivered with Red Talon issue 1 and quickly caught the eye of Publisher Star Cross Comics ran by Joe Spencer. Now Red Talon's universe has collided with Star Cross for an even wider and more thrilling universe: think Christian Marvel or DC in the making. You can help us create this dream and make sure the Red Talon brand continues for many years to come!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Red Talon issue 2 will be 18 pages. Each page of completed ink art cost us $40.  Getting each page fully colored is another $25 per page. 

With 9 pages inked and drawn we still need another $810 to finish the book. That goal seems a bit high for my first kickstarter so we will be asking for $500. This $500 can really help fund a good chunk of the book and get it close to being completed! 

The Perks: 

1. Red Talon #1 Print 

$5 USD

Physical copy of Red Talon #1

2. Red Talon #1 Print (Signed) 

$5 USD 

3. Red Talon Trading Cards

A trading Card created by Joe Spencer featuring Red Talon, his bio and power-level. These cards are standard for all Star Cross Comic characters and are collectible 

$10 USD

3. Red Talon #1 Digital Copy

$5 Digital Copy

4. Red Talon Posters

A collection of rare and collectible posters featuring Red Talon by artists David Jaxon and Brian Dawson. 

$10

5. Red Talon #2 Digital or Print Copy (Pre-Order)

$10 Donate $10 to this Perk and we guarantee that we will ship or email you (your preference) a copy of Red Talon #2 when its done. No official release date yet; this kickstarter is only asking for $500 out of $810 needed; however if you donate once the book is finished we will get issue #2 in your hands. 

6. Red Talon All Perk Bundle

Get all the above perks, plus some Red Talon stickers for a donation of $100!

story:
Malevolent Rising Issue #3 (of 6)

Kicking off where book 2 leaves off, Malevolent Rising follows the story of an alien that was bred into a life of servitude. Cybernetically and genetically enhanced to be the ultimate worker and soldier, who has escaped his former masters the star-spanning empire known as The Sovereignty. Now on Earth, he has made new allies and finds himself in a race against the clock to stop a mysterious group known as The Amatech Foundation before they set into motion events that could lead The Sovereignty to Earth.  

Secrets are revealed and new a deadly new enemy arrives. This issue changes EVERYTHING! Don't miss out on the most thrilling chapter so far!

This campaign also includes a new collected edition featuring remastered editions of issues 1 & 2. Get caught up on the story so far with this 48 page special edition which includes an all new cover, new artwork and a behind the scenes sketchbook. Also, I have created a special Covid-19 relief variant cover for Issue #3. $5.00 from each copy sold will be donated to Food Banks to help those struggling during the pandemic. All that along with special one of a kind perks.

And now for some artwork!

story:
The Sexy Pin-up Comic Book

You’ve been locked down at home for a year. But TWELVE girls, TWELVE sexy photos, and
TWELVE sexy pin-up illustrations are about to make your world VERY exciting.
The new Pin-up Instagram Model Comic Book from Gemini Comics captures a dozen models
and cosplayers in smooth, sizzling photography paired with fully illustrated representations of
these women by a dozen artists. That’s style upon style upon style – an exponential number of
aesthetic range here.
Whatever your preference or proclivity, this WILL SINK YOUR BATTLESHIP! And you’ll
learn a few things about yourself, about the world, about what’s really out there – so slide into
our DMs and Carpe Diem! Seize the opportunity to grab the new Pin-Up Instagram Model
Comic Book before anyone else.
Impress your friends and your coworkers – well, this may be NSFW, depending on your
profession or your side hustle – but you’ll know who to show this book.
This is a smooth, sexy glimpse at many possibilities that life has to offer you. So stimulate the
independent comic book economy and stimulate your imagination at the same time, and get
ready for the ride!

 What You Get

We have been working on this project for over a year, in this covid environment it went very slow but we did it and now it's ready to be in your hands, a kickass pin-up book of epic proportions, we are looking to fund this project and pay printing and shipping straight to your doors.

We have amazing perks such as:

Comic Books

Calendars

Mugs

T-shirts

and many more

 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when you do these projects especially in these times of pandemic but we have finished the book so the time of wait is cut much shorter, according to our plans we will be shipping the books in November, We want everyone to have a nice Christmas present.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share and share, support your favorite model and if you can't contribute you can help by sharing the link to your social networks.

story:
The Comic:  

During a mission Team A, a premiere group of powerful and professional superheroes, is wiped out.  The handler of Team A responds by activating Team B protocol, a backup plan in which retired and new superheroes are recruited to form a last line of defense for civilization.  The only problem is, they all have their reasons for not being active superheroes.  Now they must control their urge to strangle each other long enough to save the planet.

Team B is an ongoing, monthly comic.  The comic will be in full color.  It'll be fantastic for people who love superheroes, action, and humor.

The Characters:

Eagle Eye:  An extraordinarily skilled sniper and combat leader who retired after he lost his eyes to a super-villain.  He now commands Team B with his cutting edge cybernetics.

Apex Ape:  Philosopher.  Philanthropist.  Scientist.  Nobel Peace Prize recipient.  Last living specimen of an extinct species from twenty million years ago.  He has an unsual fondness for older women.

Lioness: Gifted with the powers of the cat by the gods of ancient Egypt, she has used these amazing powers to dominate all social media platforms.  She is accompanied by Hammurabi, a cat demi-god who loves naps.

Misstic:  A witch who escaped a death sentence in colonial Salem, Massachusetts through time travel to become the best spellcaster on Bobslist.com

Shimmer: An impossibly bubbly cheerleader and sorority sister who can bend, emit, manipulate, and become light.  She likes purple.  And puppies.  And fashion.  A lot.

Crimson Comet:  20 year old inventor of anti-gravity from a family of super-scientist superheroes.  Together with his sentient golden tamarin sidekick, Aristotle, he will make sure everyone knows they aren't as smart as he is.

Shadow Runner: Mysterious martial artist who really, really like knives- like way too much.  Freud would have a field day guy.  Seriously.  And he likes choking people.  He often whispers movie monologues to his victims before they pass out.  It's just his way of saying he likes you.

Dead-Thing:  No one really knows what he is, but he doesn't violate the sexual harassment rules so they keep him around.

Lady Gravity:  A super powered bureaucrat tasked with making sure Team B doesn't die before they complete the mission.  Although she commands the forces of the cosmos, she prefers paperwork.

The Creators:  

Andrew Balloun is a an aspiring comic book writer from Atlanta, Georgia.  He is very passionate about superheros and comic book writing.  He hopes to bring many more titles to you in the future.  For updates like us on Facebook here  

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Stampede-Comics/908305019188597?ref=aymt_homepage_panel

The artist's name is Deilson, a young extremely talented artist starting his way in the world of the comics.  His talent is incredible and already shows that will have a great future in this market.  http://deilson.deviantart.com/

The colorist is the overly masterful Derek Dow.  Keep track of this guy here  http://artmunki.deviantart.com/

The Risks:

The most obvious problem is that it's just a few people.  If there was an emergency this would be a serious problem to both the publishing of the book and fulfilling the rewards.  Fortunately everyone is in good health, so this shouldn't be an issue.

story:
About Me 

Hi! I’m Luke Lambert and I'm the artist and writer of WEAPONS FREE. I'm from Melbourne, Australia. I am a self-taught Artist, Illustrator and creative professional; with many years of video editing, producing and graphic design experience.  I LOVE comic books - especially from the 90’s era, and I can't wait to make Weapons Free. 

By backing WEAPONS FREE, you will not only be getting an awesome action packed 48+ page comic book, but you will also be helping me to realise a lifelong dream of creating my own comic. 

Motivation

I want to bring comic books back to the mainstream. To return them to their 90’s status within pop culture. To produce comics that are the illustrated equivalent of the action blockbuster movies that everyone can't wait to go and see!

WEAPONS FREE is also the foundation stone of an entire comic book company. I hope it will ring in a new era in comics where classic mythology is brought back to everyday people. Where artistic representations of these myths are of the highest quality; like we saw in the Renaissance in Europe or in the classical periods of both ancient China and Japan. I want to bring the wonder of myth and the excitement of a great comic book adventure to all people. 

What You Get

Your contributions will help me to launch the first book. This will be a 48 page full colour comic, that also includes a behind the scenes "making of" section.  As a WEAPONS FREE backer you will receive a high quality graphic novel, signed by me, Luke Lambert. If you decide to move to a higher tier of backing, you will also receive a range of WEAPONS FREE related merchandise also.  

What I Need

1. Minimum of $15,000 USD, to cover costs. 

2. Your support via social media - to get as many backers as possible. 

Timeframe

It will take me 6 months to complete the project (e.t.a. late January 2019).

Failure to Fund

If we don't reach the $15,000 USD then the project will not go ahead at this time and all money will be returned to the backers that have already pledged. 

Perks

Level 1 (starting at $20 USD + Shipping) will get you a signed copy of Weapons Free.

Level 2 (starting at $45 USD + Shipping) and upwards will get you a signed copy of WEAPONS FREE, as well as an array of WEAPONS FREE merchandise corresponding to the level of money that you pledge. 

These "Perks" can include: 

1. All comics are personally signed by Luke Lambert (that’s me!)

2. A personalised Character Sketch on your copy of WEAPONS FREE

3. A Poster and four WEAPONS FREE trading cards

4. A Limited Edition WEAPONS FREE T-Shirt

5. Full Page original Character Sketch

6. Original artwork from the actual comic itself

 

Final Thoughts

We need to restore our great myths. Human society has been built upon them for thousands of years. Comic books are one way (format) by which we can achieve this, whilst being drawn into an entertaining  adventure too! Whether for the story or just the art - join me on this epic journey. 

Thanks so much for your support everyone - it genuinely means the world to me and my family! 

All the best,

Luke Lambert
story_txt: About Me Hi! I’m Luke Lambert and I'm the artist and writer of WEAPONS FREE. I'm from Melbourne, Australia. I am a self-taught Artist, Illustrator and creative professional; with many years of video editing, producing and graphic design experience.  I LOVE comic books - especially from the 90’s era, and I can't wait to make Weapons Free. By backing WEAPONS FREE, you will not only be getting an awesome action packed 48+ page comic book, but you will also be helping me to realise a lifelong dream of creating my own comic. MotivationI want to bring comic books back to the mainstream. To return them to their 90’s status within pop culture. To produce comics that are the illustrated equivalent of the action blockbuster movies that everyone can't wait to go and see!WEAPONS FREE is also the foundation stone of an entire comic book company. I hope it will ring in a new era in comics where classic mythology is brought back to everyday people. Where artistic representations of these myths are of the highest quality; like we saw in the Renaissance in Europe or in the classical periods of both ancient China and Japan. I want to bring the wonder of myth and the excitement of a great comic book adventure to all people. What You GetYour contributions will help me to launch the first book. This will be a 48 page full colour comic, that also includes a behind the scenes "making of" section.  As a WEAPONS FREE backer you will receive a high quality graphic novel, signed by me, Luke Lambert. If you decide to move to a higher tier of backing, you will also receive a range of WEAPONS FREE related merchandise also.  What I Need1. Minimum of $15,000 USD, to cover costs. 2. Your support via social media - to get as many backers as possible. TimeframeIt will take me 6 months to complete the project (e.t.a. late January 2019).Failure to FundIf we don't reach the $15,000 USD then the project will not go ahead at this time and all money will be returned to the backers that have already pledged. PerksLevel 1 (starting at $20 USD + Shipping) will get you a signed copy of Weapons Free.Level 2 (starting at $45 USD + Shipping) and upwards will get you a signed copy of WEAPONS FREE, as well as an array of WEAPONS FREE merchandise corresponding to the level of money that you pledge. These "Perks" can include: 1. All comics are personally signed by Luke Lambert (that’s me!)2. A personalised Character Sketch on your copy of WEAPONS FREE3. A Poster and four WEAPONS FREE trading cards4. A Limited Edition WEAPONS FREE T-Shirt5. Full Page original Character Sketch6. Original artwork from the actual comic itself Final ThoughtsWe need to restore our great myths. Human society has been built upon them for thousands of years. Comic books are one way (format) by which we can achieve this, whilst being drawn into an entertaining  adventure too! Whether for the story or just the art - join me on this epic journey. Thanks so much for your support everyone - it genuinely means the world to me and my family! All the best,Luke Lambert

story:
Operation Eclipse is the story of a man who has grown tired of the crime in his city.  After the murder of his fiance and with the training from a former Army special forces veteran, Eclipse will fight to bring down the criminals and villains of St. Louis.


Ray Marek began working on Operation Eclipse back in 2007.  When he began, it started as a joke at a wedding. The idea stuck with him over time, Ray began writing scripts and reworking the characters and story concepts. Soon it became a fully realized comic project and Ray began working on bringing Eclipse to life. There were many artists previously attached to this project and Ray had many obstacles to overcome in order to get this book published. And after successfully funding on Kickstarter all production expenses have been covered for issues 1 & 2. Issue 1 is printed and in stock while issue 2 is in art production and expected to go to print by February. All money raised thru this campaign will strictly go to printing and production costs of the items pledged for and for the shipping costs of sending the rewards to our backers.

 

New to Indiegogo!

It was brought to our attention that there are separate crowds for Kickstarter & Indiegogo and we received many requests to bring this comic to Indiegogo for the good people who prefer this platform. So we are doing just that and are also offering various different reward options that will be exclusive to Indiegogo, items that were not offered thru Kickstarter and can't be found anywhere else! We have an Indiegogo exclusive variant cover as well as two exclusive Tshirts, 2 exclusive pinups, an exclusive diecut sticker and we are offering a hoodie for the very first time!

 

In case you missed out on issue 1 we're offering copies of that as well. The first issue drops you right into the action as the unbalanced and terrifyingly insane Shiver holds the Mayor of St. Louis in a dark warehouse. Shiver has him tied to a chair, next to a table of knives. When Eclipse gets word of the kidnapping, he springs in to action to help the Mayor. The only problem, he doesn't know what lurks in the shadows of the warehouse. 

 

Issue two picks up with Eclipse fighting off a couple of masked men down by the St. Louis Arch. In the distance we can see someone watching Eclipse take on these masked men. But who is it? In this issue we learn a little more about Eclipse, what drives him and why he is fighting for his city. The cover gives us a look at an all new character "Stinger". But who is "Stinger"? Back Operation Eclipse #2 to find out!

 

Issue #2 preview pages

 

Operation Eclipse issues are 22 pages of full color action.

 

 

The Rewards!

 

The Indiegogo Exclusive Sticker

 

Get the new five card set including Eclipse and four villains from the rogues gallery! Available as a special reward tier or get them as an add-on to any physical reward tier.

 

Pinup Options

 

Indiegogo Exclusive Pinup Options

 

Custom Sketch Cards

Get a 2.5"x 3.5" sketch card with a custom illustration by Jay Sloan. Any one character of your choosing. You choose a character and Jay will draw it for you.

 

Indiegogo Exclusive Tshirts!

Two different designs to choose from on your choice of black or ash grey. Available in sizes S thru XXXL.

 

Classic Hoodie Season

Get yourself a classic hoodie with the title logo printed on the front in either black or ash. First time we've ever offered a hoodie!

 

Custom Commission Artwork

Get a single character with minimal background commission on 7"x 10.5 bristol board from Jay Sloan. Any one character of your choosing. You choose a character and Jay will draw a one of kind illustration for you.

 

Indiegogo Issue #2 Collector Pack

Gimme it all! Get both cover editions of the printed comic, all four pinups, the set of five trading cards, the diecut decal & an Operation Eclipse Tshirt!

 

Art Collector's Trove

 

Shiver Original Art

Own the original 11x 17 inked artwork for the issue #1 variant cover done by Jay Sloan. This cover art features the villainous Shiver in his torture dungeon and comes with a full color print of same artwork and a printed copy of issue 1 featuring this artwork on the cover as well as a printed copy of issue 2.  Every item signed by artist Jay Sloan.

 

Eclipse Original Art

Own the original 11x 17 artwork of Eclipse inked by Jay Sloan (pencils by John Rhodes). This art piece features Eclipse on the roof tops of St. Louis and comes with a full color print of same artwork and a printed copy of issue 1 featuring the variant cover by Jay Sloan as well as a printed copy of issue 2.  Every item signed by artist Jay Sloan.

 

Stinger Original Art

Own the original 11x 17 inked artwork for the issue #2 Indiegogo exclusive variant cover done by Jay Sloan. This cover art features the mysterious Stinger leaping from buildings in downtown St. Louis and comes with a full color print of same artwork and a printed copy of issue 1 featuring Jay Sloan's Shiver variant cover as well as a printed copy of issue 2 featuring this artwork on the cover. Every item signed by artist Jay Sloan.

 

Issue #1 Preview

story:
NIGHT STARS an 125 page hardcover, follows the adventures of Adam, John, and Leslie. Normal kids gearing up for winter vacation. One afternoon while in the woods behind their house, they stumble upon a flying saucer. Inside the strange vessel, they receive special suits that give them the appearance of the classic "little green men". They quickly discover that the saucer isn't a spaceship at all but rather a time machine, which sweeps them away on a journey throughout history!

More than just a sci-fi story Night Stars is a coming of age tale that has the "Time Kids" encountering legendary figures from both fiction and nonfiction. Telling stories that will spark the curious minds of readers, while at the same time touching their hearts. It's a genre-jumping adventure where imagination is the only limit to who... or what, they will encounter next!

Welcome to the world of "The Time Kids."

Welcome to...

Not only is the ship able to transform, but their spacesuits do as well. The suits are reminiscent of the classic "little green men" and able to adapt to any environment or time period. Giving the Time Kids not only a sleek look but also the ultimate morphing camouflage!

Enjoy this sneak peak!

Another unique aspect of Night Stars is the connecting page format. Hidden inside the lines of the characters, objects, and panels is a hidden image-- ONLY visible when all of the series is connected!

Created in 2012 by writer/artist Timothy Lattie (Ghostbusters, Jay and Silent Bob Reboot, WWE, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and GI JOE) as a single issue crowdfunding campaign. It quickly caught the attention of New Jersey based production company DeCheser Media. Teaming up to produce FOUR more issues including a special addition for the United Nations. A journey spanning almost a decade that took a little known "indy" book from the deserts of New Mexico to the giant screens of Times Square!

As well as panelist and exhibitors at New York Comic con over the last few years.

“Night Stars is War Games and The Goonies meets Time Bandits and The Last Starfighter, but told in very contemporary way with great graphic storytelling. Kids will love it but I’m an adult (maybe with the heart of a kid) and I love it too. It’s something I really enjoy and recommend highly.”

Michael Uslan
Executive Producer The Batman movies, The Dark Knight Trilogy, The Lego Movies and many more.
 
And was even endorsed by Veronica Taylor voice of Ash Ketchum from Pokemon!
 

Now featuring...

including...

As well as these other great items.  Find the reward tier that's right for you!

As this campaign continues to grow, we will be adding new stretch goals once we reach new milestones. However, there is one we just can't wait to tell you about.

For our final, Stretch Goal we will be offering the opportunity for backers to receive a fully articulated modern style action figure... for FREE!

Designed by Timothy Lattie and masterfully sculpted by Adrian Melton, the NIGHT STARS Leslie action figure, with removable head and accessories is the ultimate stretch goal bonus reward! ANY backer above the $50 tier receives one at NO ADDITIONAL COST!! By sharing and helping this campaign become a success it can be yours!

story:
Story!

Cam Arthur, the last knight of her order and one of the many survivors of the fall of Yggdrasil, First Kingdom of the Seven, has been wandering aimlessly for twelve years. Her life remained directionless, until a chance encounter sets her on a grand adventure that will span the Seven Kingdoms - meeting new allies, fighting new dangers, and unraveling the mysteries of why Yggdrasil fell.

About me and goal!

Hello, my name is Daniel Vega. I am a freelance illustrator and comic artist and has worked on a five-time- Kickstarter funded series called Pretty Vacant. I’m looking to fund my first solo series called Shattered Crown: Tales of the Seven - a high-fantasy adventure set in a world where monsters, machines, and relic weapons help shape the course of this adventure. Journey with Cam and her fellow adventurers as she embarks on a quest to find answers, and those responsible for the fate of her kingdom.

This comic is kind of a one-shot preview issue that consists of 21 pages plus a few concept art pieces and would like to expand into at least one 150 page graphic novel and, if it's successful, hopefully a few books after that. Aside from the comic, I will also include sketch cards in different tiers. However, as this is my first solo work, I will take suggestions and ideas to better reward you - my potential backers - as well as streaming work on the comic every Friday as I head towards the deadline of April 2019 for complete shipping of all backer comics.

The goal is to print a set amount of at least 1000 and first send out backer comics and rewards then later see about marketing it to a few local shops around my area as well as a few of the conventions that happen here. 

 

Risks!

Although the pages have been sketched out, there remains a lot of work on them to complete. I'm hoping to be able to complete it without much delay and with some help send out all copies to backers and shops that are willing to host my comic. As  freelance artist, my income is base on what i make from month to month and maybe days where i'm unable to update on a consistent basis I will ask around for some help in keeping you all informed aside from the stream that will take place on Fridays.

story:
Quick Summary

The adventures of Le Grande Osiris started as an exciting  10 page comic called "Custom of the Sea".  It was so popular  we decided to continue the story. 

This campaign is to fund the next 20 pages of the story and release the complete 30 page book. 

Ultimately we plan to continue the endeavors of "Le Grande Osiris" in three, 30 page books. Thank you for supporting creator-owned independent comics, these books can't exists without your generosity!

The Story So Far (NSFW):

What happens next when Le Grande Osiris is taken aboard the slave ship? 

Variant Cover

Praise for "Custom of the Sea"

 

The Numbers

This is my first crowdfunder so I really don't want to fail. We are trying to keep costs as low as humanly possible. 

Art: $700

Printing: $745

Lettering: $200

Fees: $132

All unforseen costs and overruns will be paid out-of-pocket by us. 

Cheap Canadian Shipping!

Normally shipping a single copy to Canada would cost $11. But we have been able to bring the shipping cost for Canadians down to $4.  Canadians who love physical copies no longer have to suffice with just the digital version!

Rewards for Your Donations

11x17 Art Print by Nela featuring a gruesome Le Grande Osiris. We don't have a completed image for this yet, but trust me it's going to be awesome. A fitting work of art to hang on the wall of your own cave,  crypt, or dungeon. 

Nela's Sketchbook - a look into the creative process of the artists behind Le Grande Osiris, this is a PDF collection of early concepts and sketches, variant covers, etc. Also included is the full 30 page script in PDF. 

 

Cavegirls and Dinosaurs?

Lost Girls #1 follows the adventures of three girls with wildly different abilities and foibles, each one lost in the dinosaur infested jungles of planet Avadon. This all-ages comicbook by Liminalsoup is 22 pages and features a pull-out poster. 

 

Lostgirls #1: Tambi was always the best hunter in her village, but when she is chosen for a virgin sacrifice she escapes into the jungle. At first she is  confident she can survive with her archery skills. However the gods of the jungle are not pleased they have been denied human blood! 

 

Collectable Ash Cans!

What's an Ashcan?


During the golden age of comics, ashcan editions of comics were printed to establish copyright. They often went straight from the printer to the "ashcan".  Later the term was used for digest-sized prototype versions which became sought-after as a limited-edition collector's copies.

We are offering 4 ashcans editions that have never been available before. 

Ashcan edition of Custom of the Sea (10 pages, B&W)
Ashcan edition of Amen Break (10 pages, colour)
Ashcan edition of True Dinosaur Stories (10 pages, colour)
Ashcan edition of  Post-Apocalyptic Dinosaurs (8 pages, colour)

Exclusive Cover Variants

"Sketch  Cover" and "Virgin Cover" editions are Indiegogo exclusives available only during the 30 days of the campaign and never again. This is your one and only chance to get these cover variants for Le Grande Osiris #1. 

Character Cameo

At this donation level, a character based on you will be added to the book. Nela has studied classical realism and will be able to capture your visage expertly. We will need to know what kind of historical dress you will wear and what monster-killing weapon or musical instrument you will use in the comicbook. You will also get everything in the other tiers,  including all printed and all digital rewards.  Plus a heartfelt "Thank You" credit in the book. This is not just some background character with your face stuck on it. It is a unique role, based specifically on you and your tastes and will add 2 extra pages to the book bringing the page count to 32!

Milestones

To reward early supporters, and encourage everyone to spread the word, we will be offering Milestone rewards!

At 25% funding ($444) - All current backers will receive the  comic PDF "Homer & Smithe" (2 pages)

At 50% funding ($888) - All current backers will receive the PDF of "Post-Apocalyptic Dinosaurs" (8 pages)

At 75% funding ($1333) - All  current backers will receive the PDF of "True Dinosaur Stories" (10 pages). 

None of these comics have ever been released anywhere before.  These rewards will be sent out immediately when the milestone is reached, regardless of whether or not the crowdfunding campaign is ultimately successful. 

Stretch Goals - by Futurama's James Lloyd

$2500 - A variant cover by Bongo illustrator James Lloyd (Futurama Comics, Simpsons Comics) will be added. If we reach this goal, all backers of the physical book will have their choice of original or this variant cover. Thanks so much to James for agreeing to help us on this project. It is truly an honor to have such an artist participate. 

$3500 - ?????

The Creepy Creative Team

Nela (Art) - a self-taught comic artist and traditional painter from Poland. She is quickly making a name for herself in the indie horror comic scene. Nela's fantastic web comic called "Znahar: Thanatos" is available on Webtoons (currently on hiatus) and Soccer Mom Killer  is launching on  kickstarter so please support that horror comic too!

Gary (Letters) -  Xeric awarded comic book writer and illustrator, comic book colorist and letterer with over 35 years experience in printing and publishing.  Gary's Lovecraftian horror webcomic "Gods of Aazurn" updates every Wednesday on Webtoons. 

Joey (Story) - Comicbook writer from Vancouver Canada. An engineer by day, at night he plumbs the depths of the human soul with his macabre and strange stories. The creative mind behind Liminalsoup comics such as Post-Apocalyptic Dinosaurs, True Dinosaur Stories, The History of the Amen Break and Lost Girls. For the full Liminalsoup catalog visit www.liminalsoup.com

Risks & Challenges

If we are so lucky as to have a successful campaign, we will take great pride in fulfilling every single aspect of it. This is our big chance in our burgeoning careers and will are not going to blow it. By hook or by crook, whatever challenges we face, we will find a way to overcome them. Of all the teams I have worked with in indie comics, this is the most professional and capable team. I have full confidence in their ability to deliver.  

Other Ways YOU Can Help

Some people just can't contribute monetarily.

But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word about this project on social media such as facebook, twitter, reddit, etc
  • Sign-up on our mailing list to stay up-to-date on future crowdfunders as well as receive exclusives found nowhere else. 

Finally, to everyone who helps it in anyway, whether it be by your generous donation, or just by retweeting us on twitter,  I want to say thank you very much. We've poured our rotting hearts and lost souls into this project but it's all for nothing if we don't have good people like you supporting creator-owned independent comics. Thank you!
